reviews.author: Braxton N
reviews.text: I have lived here on and off since 2022. The 1st time I lived at Nexus East I loved it and that is why I decided to move back. The property is nice. But the gym could be better. Maintenance can take a while and all the changes that happened like constant switching of what payment apps or maintenance apps we had to switch around to was quite annoying when it switch from Greystar. Overall is it a ok place to live in my opinion.

reviews.author: Natasha Saenz
reviews.text:
Giving the building a 4.6/5 but Alexandria a 5/5

Had the pleasure of having this kind queen as a leasing agent, and she was welcoming, kind, AND knowledgable! made the leasing process a breeze and was super responsive to my 99 emails/questions!

As for the building itself, she's lovely. And my view is literally a chef's kiss. Great value for the price and super fab facilities all while being a stone's throw from beautiful east & downtown (if you're into that sorta thing). very clean when I moved in and already feels like home. Alexandria also goes out of her way to make folks feel included with various community activities etc.! a true shining star. Also S/O to the maintenance and pest control guys, they're 1-800-on-the-ball.

My only qualm would be that the towing company (that probably has an agreement w/ the building but idk) circle's the visitor lot each evening like blood-thirsty shahhks at feedin' time. It's extremely easy, (albeit slightly inconvenient) to register a guest's plate, make/model etc. on the app every time they visit- but also easy to forget and if you do- you're chum in the water my friend.

I understand the towing company needs to get their bag, and this isn't the building per se, but  when I moved in my leg was broken so my sisters would come by a lot to help me out and I ran out of parking permits which sucked. Aside from that ONE inconvenient aspect, terrific experience.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 3 months ago
Thank you for your wonderful review! We're absolutely thrilled to hear that Alexandria provided such exceptional service as your agent!  It's fantastic to know she was so responsive to all your questions and emails throughout the process. We truly appreciate this feedback as it helps us understand the needs of our residents and how we can always do better as a community.

reviews.author: Ryan Michael James
reviews.text:
I had several people warn me about moving into this complex before I moved in. During my first few weeks here, I also noticed that even residents who live here seemed hesitant when walking me through the community. I tried to stay optimistic, but things have continued to go wrong.

They have repeatedly messed up my rent, and I’ve had to go into the office multiple times to get it corrected. The hot water regularly goes out. Trash valet does not run nearly as smoothly as advertised. There are homeless individuals living in the dumpster area, and until very recently, there was no nighttime security at all. To be clear, they just hired nighttime security a couple of days ago, after months of ongoing issues reported by residents.

There are no security cameras in the hallways or parking lots because management claims it would be an “infringement of privacy,” even though residents have repeatedly asked for basic safety measures. Packages go missing almost daily, despite management insisting their mail delivery system is “foolproof.” It isn’t. Someone’s car was stolen (not towed—stolen) from inside the gated parking lot.

The parking areas are constantly littered with residents’ dog poop. I personally had a package stolen from the mailroom, and management admitted they have video footage of a homeless man entering and stealing packages. On top of that, my rental vehicle was towed even though I had a valid visitor permit.

I’ve lived here for less than two months and have experienced an unbelievable number of issues. There is an entire resident group chat that is nothing but daily complaints about how poorly this place is managed. I truly tried to stay positive and go with the flow, but I’m exhausted by the constant problems and the lack of meaningful action from management.

I do not recommend moving here.

reviews.author: Melissa Cantu
reviews.text: Package was stolen today. I know the UPS guy and he definitely delivered it. A few months ago maintenance left my door unlocked AND OPEN. They were in such a rush, didnt close it all the way before locking it so bolt had it cracked open for over 5 hours. Definitely dont feel safe here anymore. I could say a lot more but dont care to spend any more of my time.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 4 weeks ago
We’re very sorry to hear about your experience and understand your frustration. Our community uses Fetch for package deliveries, and they do offer a “hand it to me” option. If there are ever issues with Fetch, please contact our office so we can address them right away. We also sincerely apologize for your past experience with maintenance and take concerns like this seriously. Please contact us at (888) 219-9471 to address these matters immediately.

reviews.author: Jenna G
reviews.text:
PROS:
Quiet area. We don’t hear loud cars passing or anything.
Great move in deal!
I Love the finishes in the units! My unit has a blue backsplash that is so so cute. Huge island in the kitchen with white counter tops.
Very new, paint is not chipped or gross.
The tubs are pretty big and wide.
Walls in the units are pretty thick.
The pool/pool area is usually kept very clean
The building is About 10 minutes from the airport but you barley hear planes!
There’s a community pool/billiards table.
There’s a little market in the mail room full of snacks you can buy.
They’ll do monthly community events like yoga or brunch!

CONS:
lots of security concern. Lots of package theft- even with their fetch service. Fetch has not the best hours too which aren’t helpful if you work long days. Be prepared to buy a ring camera.
Shower water is finicky. Lots of water issues. Don’t recommend if you love hot showers. This is my biggest issue
Walking/parking near the dog park always smells like piss or poop :( people don’t always use baggies to pick up the poop
The balconies that face the pool get COVERED in dust and dirt. It’s hard to have furniture and plants.
They did a resident of the month event thing… and had an AI resident to win the prize …
The hallways on the various floors are not cleaned often unless you ask them to clean it

A lot of the reviews seem to be from people who only toured and haven’t moved in so that made me wary

FYI:
Be very careful with guest parking because they always have tow trucks taking cars.

Apartment was not cleaned upon move in - BUT management did make it up to us with a credit towards our rent.

Ignore reviews about grey star since kairoi is the new management.

With the X free weeks of move in deal, if you choose to Prorate rent it needs to be done manually with a money order. Can’t be done through the app. Not awful just inconvenient.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 6 months ago
Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback. We appreciate your honest perspective and will address the maintenance and cleanliness concerns.

reviews.author: Craig West
reviews.text: Living at Nexus East has been a great experience! The community is clean, the amenities are well maintained, and maintenance requests are always handled quickly. The front office staff truly goes above and beyond. Alexandria Rojas once personally came out to help me jump my truck, which really showed how much she cares. Allen is also always friendly, happy, and greets me every morning with a smile — it’s little things like that that make a big difference. Having staff like Alexandria and Allen makes living here easy and enjoyable. I highly recommend Nexus East to anyone looking for a great place to live.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 4 months ago
Thank you for your wonderful feedback, Craig! We're delighted Alexandria and Allen made your experience exceptional. Their dedication truly makes a difference.

reviews.author: Dishary Hossain
reviews.text:
This is the worst apartment I’ve lived in for the price that they charge. Take recent reviews with a grain of salt because they capture the opinions of new residents rather than long term ones such as myself. On the surface it seems like a decent apartment. They have a nice business center, lobby, pool area, and rooftop. But I would say the praise ends there. Allen is the typically the one that responds to us the most so I will give them credit for that employee in specific.

There are systemic issues that only temporarily get fixed. Sometimes, the parking lot exit gates do not automatically open. The dog park is pathetic - it’s small and has turf, which traps every type of smell from pet bathroom breaks. The residents as a whole don’t care to pick up after their dogs. Consistent water pressure issues pop up every few months. Same with the elevator, which they don’t care to fix permanently. Even when the elevator does work, there’s always some sort of mess on the floor (the cleaning crew barely cleans it as is). The AC system gets overburdened and our electricity costs get driven up because it takes 2 hours to cool a small 1 bedroom. The printer periodically does not work. The staff does not care to upkeep the coffee machine. We went through a property management change where we switched from the horrendous Greystar to Kairoi. I will give the leasing office some credit for being a bit more responsive, however I don’t think I should praise on-site staff for doing the bare minimum. They gave minimal notice when it came to the parking registration rules which is not legally complaint (I pointed it out and they did not respond) Given how they handle issues, I really don’t think they care about improving the resident experience. I’ve never been so happy to move out of a complex.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 4 months ago
Thank you for sharing your concerns. We value your input and will address the issues you've mentioned. Please feel free to reach out to us at (888) 219-9471 for further assistance.

reviews.author: TlcJoshua
reviews.text:
Incredible Service & Great Living at Nexus East!

I’ve had an outstanding experience at Nexus East so far, from the initial inquiry to move-in day, everything has been smooth, professional, and genuinely welcoming. I want to give a special shoutout to Bruce, the leasing agent who helped me out every step of the way. He was incredibly knowledgeable, patient with my (many) questions, and made the whole process feel stress-free.

The community itself is clean, modern, and well-maintained. The amenities are top-notch, and the location is perfect! Close to everything without feeling too hectic. It’s clear the staff here actually care about the residents.

If you're looking for a place that feels like home and a leasing team that treats you like more than just a number, I highly recommend Nexus East. And if you get the chance to work with Bruce that's even better!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 5 months ago
Your positive experience at Nexus East is greatly appreciated. Thank you for sharing your feedback!

reviews.author: Wesley Mitchell
reviews.text: The management team is unlike any I’ve dealt with—very understanding and willing to work with residents. We had an issue when moving out, and at first, I owed $600 after my $500 security deposit. However, after working with Valerie, everything was straightened out. I really appreciate the personable and fair approach they took in resolving the issue.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 4 months ago
We're excited to hear about your positive experience with our management team. Thank you for sharing your feedback!

reviews.author: Kathy Saenz
reviews.text: Today we had a bad experience with the Leasing Agent. She was very rude to my 18 year old daughter and me. I traveled from San Antonio to see the apartments because my daughter is a freshman at UT Austin, studying Biology and definitely needs an apartment. For now, she lives in the University dorms, but for comfort, she wants to move to an apartment. The lady was very rude and quite annoyed. She answered our questions, of course, she didn't want to ask us anything else. She made us feel extremely uncomfortable. It was a very unpleasant experience. She was wearing a green dress, was short, and had long hair. At no point did she say her name, so we didn't even ask her, I hope. Of course, she ruined the image or hope of my daughter living in this apartment complex.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 3 months ago
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We’re very sorry to hear that your tour did not reflect the warm, welcoming environment we strive to provide. This is not the standard we hold ourselves to, and your feedback is something we take seriously. Please don’t hesitate to reach out at 888-219-9471 — we’d really appreciate the opportunity to speak with you directly and learn more about what happened.

reviews.author: Bree Coward
reviews.text:
Nexus East Apartment complex is one of the least professional, poorly maintained, cash grabbing apartments I have ever been to
They intentionally do not have lighting or clear signs or markers for visitor parking so that they can make money off of towing people.
At night. There is no lighting for visitors parking.
The only marker is scratched off painted words on the concrete
Which again please make that make sense with their being one singular lamp post ?!
They’re simply unprofessional. They don’t even notify you if a car gets towed if you’ve made a visitor pass for it.
It’s clearly a scam and I have been towed before and never experienced something this shady .
Makes sense why they have sucu aggressive turnover with staff.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 3 months ago
We’re sorry to hear about your experience with parking, and understand how frustrating this must have been. We ask that residents provide clear instructions to their guests if signage and ground markings are missed. Please contact the front office if you’d like further information or assistance—we’d be happy to help clarify our parking guidelines.

reviews.author: Johanna Gretschel
reviews.text: I attended a holiday party event in the community game room and the amenities were perfect for our group’s needs! It was easy to navigate the complex, the room had everything we needed and a fun night was had by all!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner a month ago
We genuinely admire your positive feedback! Thank you for letting us know about your experience at Nexus East.

reviews.author: Nick Pogacnik
reviews.text: I have never experienced more maintenance issues in my entire life before moving here. The lack of urgency from the maintenance team and the repeated breaking of the same things that have supposedly been fixed Is off the charts. For example, within the last three months, they have come to fix my microwave seven times. I understand that stuff happens although at some point, people are not doing their job. The leasing office Manager, Valerie is super dismissive of any issues and does the bare minimum to try and help out. The rest of the staff is really cool, although Valerie doesn’t seem to value the tenant’s time, money, or maintenance issues. Really disappointed in my experience with her and extremely frustrated with the apartments constant breakdowns of different appliances and amenities. Overall, it is overpriced and unreliable with an almost clueless staff at times.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 3 months ago
We apologize for any inconvenience with maintenance issues and microwave repairs. Your concerns about staff responsiveness are noted. Please contact us at (888) 219-9471.

reviews.author: Kaela Cleary
reviews.text:
I’ve lived here for a year and just renewed my lease. Great amenities and quick maintenance. Secluded from hustle and bustle of city but still very close to great
spots.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner a month ago
We're grateful for your positive feedback on your experience at Nexus East. Thank you for sharing your thoughts!

reviews.author: Sofia
reviews.text: I had a tour with this apartment and was looking forward to it… but the lady that gave us the tour was super rude. She was the leasing agent I’m guessing who gives the tours to the guests. I’m someone who won’t say anything and will keep my mouth shut, definitely a people pleasure and this is my first time writing a review, but I had to because this was such a bad experience, I was very uncomfortable to say the least. She was giving us a lot of attitude and being underhandingly sarcastic, where you can tell someone is annoyed… she was making faces to my mom and giving her attitude when asking questions. She was wearing a green dress, is pretty short and has curly beige hair, I wish I had gotten her name but please try getting someone that is nice for your tour… The apartment is nice and all (I did see a bug on the ceiling of the model home but I digress), but the leasing agent definitely made me not want to even consider the place.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 3 months ago
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We’re truly sorry to hear that your tour did not reflect the level of service we aim to provide. This is absolutely not the standard we hold ourselves to, and we take your feedback very seriously. We want every guest and prospective resident to feel welcome, respected, and comfortable during their visit. Please give us a call at 888-219-9471 at your earliest convenience — we’d truly value the chance to connect and make things right.

reviews.author: nancy m espinosa
reviews.text: My experience with Alexandria was awesome. She gave a very informative tour. We got to see all the amenities.  She was very knowledgeable and poured of the complex she was showing. I appreciate her time. Thank you
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 5 months ago
We are glad to hear about your awesome experience with Alexandria. Thank you for sharing your feedback!

reviews.author: Airid
reviews.text: Finding apartments took forever, we had bad luck everywhere we tried, we went with Nexus East and so far it’s been great! Especially Allen, he originally gave us a tour and we still see him around a lot and he’s always eager to help us out! He is a very kind and upstanding young man, funny too!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner a month ago
Your positive feedback is greatly appreciated! We are thrilled to hear about your experience with Nexus East and Allen. Thank you for sharing your thoughts!

reviews.author: Tanisha Gilmore
reviews.text: Very deceptive complex for college students. Buyer beware. $250 application fee for a student and parent guarantor. I wouldn’t even be living in the apartment, just a guarantor since a college student couldn’t possibly make 3x rent! anyway, I decided to rent somewhere with less fees and cheaper for my daughter and Valerie says $150 admin fee is non refundable!! Like WHAT?  I mean $250 for filling out an application for 1 college student that didn’t move in is GOOD profiteering THATS for sure!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 3 months ago
Thank you for your feedback. Our application and administrative fees are standard across the market and outlined before applying for clarity. We’re happy to share our application and fee sheet for full transparency—please contact our office anytime. Regarding application fees, please contact us at (888) 219-9471 to discuss further.

reviews.author: Ester Silva
reviews.text: I’ve been several days without hot water, and the issue still hasn’t been resolved. The temperature inside is under 45°F, which makes it really uncomfortable to live here. Management has not provided any effective solution or clear communication. I do not recommend this place.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 2 months ago
We sincerely apologize for any inconveniences you have gone through while we services our Tankless Water System last month.  Your concerns are valid and we want to ensure you that your hot water should not be interrupted moving forward, but please do not hesitate to contact us at 888-219-9471 us if you need assistance.

reviews.author: Jenna King
reviews.text: Don’t waste your time here. For what you pay in rent, you don’t even get basic amenities like reliable hot water.  I’ve gone weeks without it. Management gives conflicting explanations, rarely communicates, and keeps blaming previous ownership instead of finding real solutions.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 2 months ago
We sincerely apologize for any inconveniences you have gone through while we services our Tankless Water System last month.  Your concerns are valid and we want to ensure you that your hot water should not be interrupted moving forward, but please do not hesitate to contact us at 888-219-9471 us if you need assistance.

reviews.author: Rosie Scanga
reviews.text:
I do not live here but my partner does. I do not recommend. For anyone new to austin the location is so ugly off of 183 and there's nothing walking distance that is really worth going to. It's east side but there's nothing nice around it.

There's also mold in the apartments.

The hot water in the shower doesn't always work.

And finally the towing situation is absolutely ridiculous. The rules are constantly changing and impossible to keep up with. There is a tow truck there almost every night and it costs $240 to pick up your car. It is not clear where you can and can't park and even though I thought I knew the rules I have been towed twice. Terrible experience for guests and residents. Not like anyone would even want to go to the apartments anyway except for when our innocent partners and friends are trapped there in a lease.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 6 months ago
We are sorry to hear about your partners dissatisfaction here at Nexus East. We would love to have your partner reach out to us at 512-389-5269 to discuss the hot water and possible natural growth, as we would treat these issues as a priority work order. We have not changed the towing policies in the past year, but the company that we used did update their registration portal. Please ensure you scan the QR codes and park in the visitor parking area. We would be happy to assist you with this at anytime in the front office!

reviews.author: go out and live
reviews.text: Moving to Nexus was an absolute breeze. It was the most seamless and efficient move I’ve ever been a part of. Even amidst the occasional hiccups, Allen and Valerie were exceptional. From the amenities to the friendly staff, and even the consistent attention to ensuring the coffee machine worked flawlessly, Nexus truly exceeded our expectations. If you’re looking to relocate to the Austin area, Nexus is an excellent choice.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 6 months ago
Thank you for taking the time to share your seamless moving experience. We're thrilled Allen and Valerie exceeded expectations!

reviews.author: E F
reviews.text: DO NOT MOVE IN HERE. they put on a good show to hook you in but once you sign your lease ALL service disappears. The gates to the parking lot are ALWAYS broken. Pretty sure im paying full rent for a fully functioning property. When the parking lot gate doent work for 2 weeks at a time every month their answer is too bad. Ive been here 3 months and its been broken literally every month with no recourse. homeless people always wandering the grounds and cars being broken into. You will constantly has packages stolen, trash absolutely everywhere in the halls/stairs and around the property. The parking lot is over populated so as a tenant who pays rent youll have to park in guest parking out front not secure area because people let their friends park in the tenant lot and the management doesnt do a damn thing about it. And they just bumped their prices even higher. Do yourself a favor and rent at one of the many places down the street closer to the city for a better price and better community.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 5 months ago
Sorry for any inconvenience you have experienced at Nexus East. We take your feedback seriously and would like to address your concerns. Please feel free to reach out to us at (888) 219-9471 to discuss further.

reviews.author: Garret Haggarton
reviews.text: I recently had an amazing experience touring apartments and working with Claudio. From start to finish, he made the apartment hunting process a smooth, stress-free, and even fun. He’s super knowledgeable about the local market. He’s super knowledgeable about the local market, answered all my questions quickly, and really listened to what I was looking for. Claudio went above and beyond to find options that matched my needs and budget— he never made me feel rushed or pressured. Highly recommend Claudio if you’re looking for someone who’s professional , patient, and genuinely cares about you helping the right place.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 7 months ago
Your feedback is incredibly valuable. We are thrilled to hear about your positive experience with Claudio at Nexus East. Thank you for sharing your thoughts!

reviews.author: Nichole Anderson
reviews.text: Allen in the leasing office is phenomenal! He’s so friendly and had a great attitude! Much better experience touring with him than any other apartment complex I’ve been to. Such a beautiful community!!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 6 months ago
Thank you for your review! We're thrilled Allen provided such a phenomenal experience. His friendly attitude makes all the difference!

reviews.author: Johnny Perez
reviews.text: The rooms are a great size. Alexandria helped answer all my questions and even showed me the gym twice. Really impressive property.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 5 months ago
Thank you very much for your kind comments, Johnny! We are delighted to know you appreciated the generously sized accommodations and that our team member, Alexandria, provided great service!

reviews.author: Victoria Herrera
reviews.text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Claudio was honestly awesome throughout the whole leasing process. Super friendly, easy to talk to, and made everything way less stressful. He answered all my questions, kept me updated, and just made sure everything went smoothly. You can tell he really cares about the people who live here. I’m really glad I had his help — made moving in a way better experience!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 7 months ago
We are thrilled to hear about your positive experience with Claudio at Nexus East. Thank you for sharing your feedback!

reviews.author: Evan Dannenhirsch
reviews.text: Some of the best pricing in East Austin, and super conveniently located with a lot of new things to do popping up nearby. Nexus East is a modern and luxurious property but it falls short of the more expensive competition that has opened in the last 2 years nearby. But not in any serious ways. It's a good value, and has great amenities.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 6 months ago
We are grateful for your positive feedback on Nexus East. Thank you for highlighting our great amenities and value.

reviews.author: Jason Stewart
reviews.text: This property has a big gym and a really nice pool. The pool area is quiet on the weekdays and always kept clean. The staff is nice too
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 5 months ago
Your positive experience at Nexus East is greatly appreciated. Thank you for sharing your feedback.

reviews.author: ogeddie0211
reviews.text: Claudio was outstanding! From start to finish, he provided top-notch customer service and made the hotel tour a smooth and enjoyable experience. Huge thank you to him and the team definitely made a great impression!

Response from the owner 7 months ago
Your positive experience with Claudio is greatly appreciated. Thank you for sharing your feedback!

reviews.text: Really happy living here so far. The amenities are great and always in good shape, and the whole property is kept super clean. Anytime I’ve had a question or needed something, the staff has gotten back to me fast and they’re always friendly and polite. It’s been a solid experience overall.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 7 months ago

reviews.author: Ebony Rubalcava
reviews.text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Claudio is honestly the reason this place gives “home sweet home” vibes instead of “just another apartment.” From day one, he’s been a total icon — helpful, friendly, and always on point. Like, I’ll have a question and boom, Claudio’s already got it handled before I can even stress about it. He’s got that perfect mix of professional and “I got you, bestie” energy, and I am here for it. Seriously, give this man a crown already — he keeps this place together and makes it feel like more than just a building. Claudio, you’re a star! 🌟💖👏
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 7 months ago
Thank you for your wonderful feedback! Claudio truly shines at Nexus East, providing exceptional service and creating a welcoming environment for all residents. We appreciate your kind words.

reviews.author: Carlos Jaimes
reviews.text: Good place but there have been 2 water shut offs within the last two weeks and the water never gets hot enough to wash dishes. Any faucet water only gets lukewarm.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 3 months ago
Thank you for your feedback. We apologize for the recent repairs and any inconvenience they may have caused. If you experience any further issues, please submit a work order so our team can address them promptly—we’d be happy to help. Please contact us at (888) 219-9471 to discuss further.

reviews.author: Issael Martinez
reviews.text: Just want to take a moment and say i love the maintenance staff here, but i want to give a huge shout to Mr.Claudio he is so nice, awesome. Community always clean, pet friendly. Also im in love with my new home.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 7 months ago
We're privileged to hear about your positive experience at Nexus East! Thank you for sharing your feedback.

reviews.author: Robert Mackey
reviews.text: This is one of the best experiences I've had during what we all know to be one of the most stressful times, moving. Chelsey Combs was friendly and professional which made the information I received easier to rely on, which is key! I'm pretty sure the 1 star reviews are from extenuating circumstances because, on a bad day, I'd rate no lower than a 4 star. Great place and dog friendly!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 9 months ago
It's a pleasure to hear about your positive experience with Chelsey Combs at Nexus East. Your feedback is truly appreciated!

reviews.author: Lana Richards
reviews.text: I stopped in for a late in the day tour as I'm viewing all the apartments in the area for my move to Austin and Termisha really left a positive experience in my day! We discussed everything I had concerns over in this stressful time of moving between cities and she made me feel well informed and comfortable. I am making my decision soon and honestly this place is high on my list because it met all my needs PLUS has amazing office personnel like Miss. Termisha. Thank you!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 8 months ago
Thank you for sharing your experience at Nexus East. We're thrilled to hear that Termisha provided you with a positive tour experience. Your feedback is greatly appreciated.

reviews.author: Daniel Moore
reviews.text: The towing company they contracted towed me within ten minutes of me parking in the visitor lot after I registered. NOT ONLY that , but they severely damaged my bumper to my essentially brand new  BMW M2.  Extremely disappointed in how aggressive and negligent this all feels. My girlfriend will not be renewing her lease.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 6 months ago
We apologize for any inconvenience this has caused, and would love to look into this further. Please contact us at (888) 219-9471 to discuss this matter further.

reviews.author: Sierra Escobedo
reviews.text: A great community! The office staff are very welcoming and helpful, and the property is always well maintained. It’s in a great spot—close to a bunch of restaurants and fun things to do, plus it’s an easy drive to downtown Austin and nearby Parks.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 9 months ago
We're ecstatic to hear you're enjoying your experience at Nexus East! Thank you for taking the time to share your positive feedback.

reviews.author: Rae Hope
reviews.text: Just moved in and was welcomed with a pup cup and a cookie which was a nice surprise. My apartment had one issue with the garage disposal but a maintenance guy was able to come the same day to fix it. Nice office staff and the neighbors seem nice!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 9 months ago
We appreciate you taking the time to share your positive experience at Nexus East. We're delighted to hear that you received a warm welcome and that your maintenance issue was addressed efficiently.  Thank you for your feedback.

reviews.author: Nelson Rivera
reviews.text: Toured the A1 Floor Plan with Alexandria and absolutely loved it. Beautiful and well maintained amenities. It has everything you want and things you didn't even know you wanted. Highly suggest taking a look and see for yourself. The rep Alexandria was very kind and informative, no pressure, it was a great experience. Thank you.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 8 months ago
Thank you immensely for sharing your experience with us, Nelson. We're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed touring the A1 Floor Plan with Alexandria and loved the amenities. Your feedback is greatly appreciated.

reviews.author: Trenton Bright
reviews.text: Went in there expecting just another tour that was until it was Allen showing me around, very professional but not afraid to let his whimsy show ! Wish I could get a tour every day from him
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 6 months ago
Thanks for the wonderful feedback about Allen! We're thrilled his professional yet whimsical approach made your tour memorable.

reviews.author: Bradley Luzietti
reviews.text:
Omg wow, holy fudge this place just blew my socks off

I literally have no socks on. The place took my socks, and will not give them back.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner a month ago
Your feedback is incredibly valuable. We appreciate your input. Thank you for your feedback.

reviews.author: Fernie Pardo
reviews.text: Allen It’s awesome. Customer service, and his real attentive to us as residents. And made my transferring from apartment to apartment. So easy and smooth. Thank you sir.

Pool and gym are nice though.

Hunter Yadon, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. Thanks for bringing this matter to our attention. We would like to get more details about this; please reach out to us at your earliest convenience at (512) 389-5369.

Thank you, 
Nexus East Managment Team
nexuseast@greystar.com

reviews.author: Brett Peters
reviews.text: Amazing property and very great management team! Love my unit and location
reviews.response_text:

Thank you for your review! We're thrilled to hear you're enjoying your unit and the location at Nexus East.

reviews.author: InTheSpotlight With McC
reviews.text: Beautiful community, the staff was very friendly. From the moment I walked in Claudio and Allan made me feel welcomed. Their smiles lit up the office. Thank you for a great tour.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 8 months ago
We are delighted to hear Claudio and Allen made you feel welcomed during your tour. Thank you for highlighting their friendly service and our beautiful community.

reviews.author: M S
reviews.text: Went by just for a quick tour and was greeted with a positive atmosphere.  The team really knows what they are talking about!!! I am really considering making this my next home!!!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 5 months ago
Thanks for visiting! We're thrilled you felt the positive atmosphere and appreciated our knowledgeable team. Hope to welcome you home soon!

reviews.author: Sarah Barnes
reviews.text:
Have lived in apartments in Austin for 7 years and after living here for 4 months I’ll tell you this is one of the worst places you could choose. Again, having rented in Austin from greystar and maa for 7+ years I have never received a single lease violation, though after 4 months here have received 3.

The units themselves are fine aside from a major apartment wide mold issue l, but it’s management that makes living in this community a complete nightmare. Management will find a reason to fine you at least once monthly. They overcharged me $70 for utilities and after months of back and forth where the leasing office assured me they would refund the mistake, the manager admitted he had no intention of doing this. There is a major issue with humidity in building one, leading many of the residents to find mold covering their clothes and shoes. I’ve put in several work orders about abnormally high humidity levels (residents have reported upwards of 70% humidity recorded in unit) with no change. My walls and cabinets are often covered in condensation, and any paper goods in my unit are immediately damaged. If you’re looking to get fined $50 for forgetting to bring your broom in after sweeping the patio of your apartment while the elevators, doors, and gates are constantly broken and the pool is constantly closed ( Don’t forget about that mold issue) this is the place for you. If you like getting towed and receiving attitude from the leasing staff who will NOT refund you, or if you like it when your friends get towed (properly registered residents and visitors are often towed) or having your car stolen… this is a great place. I have never in my 7 years of renting dealt with such constant aggression and intense scrutiny from management and am excited to not renew my lease at this apartment.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner a year ago
Hi Sarah,

Thanks for your feedback and for sharing your concerns. We do have some units dealing with an HVAC system issue but have engaged a mechanical engineer and are taking steps to rectify the issue. I will have the team contact you about next steps if you are experiencing issues in your home.

With regards to towing, we do have a resident and guest system to ensure we only have registered vehicles at the site. I have not received any recent reports of registered vehicles being towed but would happy to look into this for you, if you'd like to email me the details. Also, we haven't had any true vehicle thefts at the site that have been reported. There was one repossession of a vehicle but that was handled by a third party. Happy to look into anything as mentioned. Feel free to email me at ana.wright@greystar.com. Thanks!

reviews.author: Vasanth Baskar
reviews.text: They just tow all visitors car without registration even if it stays for just half hour. And they ask all leasing information to register your car for visitors pass and how will visitors have the leasing information. Their sign is a small black board that doesn’t mention where your car is towed too. 4 of my friends got their car towed. Don’t rent here or don’t have friends who have cars if you rent here
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 8 months ago
It's regrettable to hear about your experience at Nexus East. Please feel free to reach out to us at (888) 219-9471 to discuss this further.

reviews.author: Vanessa Cruz
reviews.text: The community is well maintained, the amenities are excellent, the staff is friendly and responsive. The overall atmosphere feels welcoming and cozy.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 8 months ago
Thank you for the 5-Star review Vanessa!

reviews.author: Camila
reviews.text:
New management sucks. Greystar.

Got poisoning from coffee machine that obviously doesn’t get changed or cleaned often. Fees for literally anything and everything. Tiny fake grass excuse of a dog park. Cleaning crew makes the entire complex smell like a public restroom. Cleaning crew will literally also step on your feet to get their job done quickly. Old management was amazing. Looks like they may have lost funds. Nothing ever even works anymore since old management left.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner a year ago
Good morning, Camila-

Thank you for your feedback. I do not show a resident under the name Camila, listed in our system. Could you perhaps have the wrong property? Management has not changed on this site in 3 years. Would love to discuss your concerns further if applicable to this community. Please feel free to email me directly, ana.wright@greystar.com . Thanks!

reviews.author: Kabu Katei
reviews.text:
Amazing location with a diligent property management staff! Maintenance Team is always quick and ready on standby for any of my service needs both major and minor. The amenities are impeccable from the resort style pool all the way to the apartment Gym which has two floors and is stocked with equipment.

My time here has been nothing short of spectacular and I look forward to renewing my lease here next year.

I would like to make a special shout of to the property management team at the front desk who are readily available and are always willing to hear out any issues of mine no matter the severity.

Nexus East is the best apartment community I have ever had the opportunity to live in.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 4 years ago
Wow, Kabu! We're over the moon to see these shoutouts to our team members! We are just delighted to hear that you are loving our community and maintenance service. If you ever need anything, please let us know. We're always happy to help!

reviews.author: Mark Shore
reviews.text:
I’ve lived in this apartment complex for two years. I was the first resident to move into my apartment. Overall, I love living here. Great location for me. Nice pool with gas grills. One of the better onsite gyms I’ve seen. Nice shared work space, lobby area and rooftop clubhouse but I don’t really use those much. The ONE amenity I use daily is the large grass area behind the complex that we were permitted to use for our dogs. Lately, they decided that because of a report of a flea infestation months ago that through a series of supposed exchanges with the city, we aren’t allowed to use the area any longer and doing so would be a lease violation. Having broken vehicle and pedestrian gates, doors within the community that don’t lock properly, rampant package theft even with the forced use of Fetch package delivery service instead of the onsite lockers we used to use and sketchy vehicle transactions happening in the parking lot don’t seem to be any concern to management. I brought a lot of these security concerns to management on April 6, 2023 and they still haven’t been fixed but keeping my dog out of an area we’ve used for two years is apparently more important.

EDIT (01/08/2024): The security issues still remain but the complex has put a padlock on the gate into the large grass area that we use as an off-leash pet area.  I'm sure they'll say "it was the city" but the city isn't going to come out and unlock that gate when the landscapers come.  Stop lying.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner Edited 2 years ago
Hello Mark, 

Thank you so much for your feedback. As we have told you and all residents previously, the detention pond and biofiltration system behind Nexus East is City of Austin property, and Nexus East is responsible for landscaping maintenance, pollution control, and ensuring controlled access. It is not - and has never been - a dog park, dog run, or amenity for residents, regardless of what previous management may have incorrectly told you. The City of Austin placed a placard stating that the area is not for public access, and we have locked the gates due to repeated unauthorized resident access to the area. We take our responsibility to the City of Austin seriously, as well as the overall maintenance of Nexus East, which is why the area has been secured. 

With respect to your concerns regarding security, we are working to replace our pedestrian gate locks which have been previously replaced several times this year, and we work on a daily and weekly basis to ensure that the vehicle gates are operating correctly as well as the rest of the access points within the property. 

Please feel free to reach out to us directly regarding your concerns and we will be happy to address them with you further. Thank you for your continued feedback and helping us ensure Nexus East is a comfortable place to live, and we hope to hear from you soon.

Nexus East

reviews.author: Atenor Ovalles
reviews.text: Came to visit today at Nexus East, Termisha was super nice and welcoming. Would definitely recommend touring with her if you are looking to move to Nexus East!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 8 months ago
Thanks for your positive feedback, Atenor! We greatly appreciate your recommendation.

reviews.author: Dana Scholten
reviews.text: The location is nice and the amenities for the price are pretty good, but the changes they've made recently have really upset the residents. The office is slow to respond to questions, if they even respond at all,  things are broken left and right, we're forced to pay for and use Fetch despite almost no one having a positive experience, and they recently closed the dog park. I actually like living here too, just a bummer that it's starting to go downhill.
reviews.response_text:

Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we did. We hope you have a great day!

reviews.author: Sara Derballa
reviews.text: I love this complex! It’s literally the nicest apartment I’ve ever lived in at such a cheap price (compared to CA). The amenities and pool is like resort style, it’s super nice. The fancy coffee machine is a game changer! The rooftop patio and common areas are decorated to a T. The apartment itself has the most current appliances, open kitchen, cute backsplash. On the fourth floor in the corner, I have the most amazing patio. Overall, 10 outta 10!!
reviews.response_text:

Hi Sara Derballa, thank you so much for your positive comments about Nexus East!

reviews.author: Jon Crow
reviews.text: I had an excellent experience today touring your property and I thought the building looked to be clean and in great shape, well cared for, hallways were clean and good to see people enjoying the common spaces. Leasing agent Christian was very helpful in explaining the options we have in choosing the right unit for us, and answered all our questions enthusiastically. We are encouraged by knowledgeable and helpful staff!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 2 years ago
Jon Crow, we're happy to hear you had such a positive experience with our team!

reviews.author: Tom S
reviews.text:
Overall, I have really enjoyed the apartment complex. My unit is great, the location is near perfect, and the amenities are solid.

However, there have been major issues with the package room, as I have had two packages stolen. There is a locker system, but I have had packages NOT placed in the lockers, and I did not receive any notifications alerting me a package has been delivered. I am not sure if this falls on management or the delivery companies. The package system is a disaster, and until this is resolved I cannot leave the good review which I want to leave.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 3 years ago
Hi Tom,

Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We sincerely apologize about the issues you experienced, and we hope to make this right. The great news is that we plan to open the oversized package room by mid September! This is exciting news as we know the struggles many communities endure with package systems. Please know, we care and are working hard behind the scenes to make our community a more enjoyable place!

reviews.author: Christian Jaramillo
reviews.text:
A Bewildering Experience at Nexus East Apartment Complex.

I am writing this review to express my deep dissatisfaction with Nexus East Apartment Complex. While I initially moved in with high hopes, my experience has been marred by a series of frustrations and disappointments.

Firstly, I've had several issues with the maintenance staff. On multiple occasions, they have entered my apartment without prior notice or while I was not present, which is a gross invasion of my privacy. The lack of respect for the personal space of tenants is extremely troubling.

Secondly, the advertisement of a dog park and water retention park was a major selling point for me. However, this turned out to be false advertising. The so-called "dog park" is nothing more than a tiny patch of fake grass, and the "water retention park" is now non-existent. This misleading information is not only unethical but also a disservice to potential residents who are making decisions based on these amenities.

Lastly, and perhaps most concerning, is the issue with the complex's gates. They are frequently broken and remain open, allowing free access to the property. This lack of security has directly resulted in thefts in the complex. The management has shown little urgency or concern in addressing this significant safety issue.

Furthermore, the customer service at Nexus East is deplorable. The management lacks accountability and has shown little to no interest in resolving the issues we have brought to their attention. Requests and complaints seem to fall on deaf ears, leaving us feeling ignored and undervalued as residents.

In conclusion, living at Nexus East Apartment Complex has been a frustrating and disappointing experience. The management's lack of regard for tenant rights, false advertisement of amenities, and poor customer service have made my stay here an ordeal. I strongly advise potential renters to consider these issues before choosing to live at Nexus East.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 2 years ago
Hi Christian, 
Thank you so much for your feedback. We would like to discuss your concerns again in detail in person if you would like to have a meeting. As discussed before when requesting a maintenance request or pest control service this is you giving us permission to enter your home. Any other time we may enter you home would be due to required inspections per city requirements such as our Fire Inspections, etc. which we provide advance notices for. 

As we have told you and all residents previously, the detention pond and biofiltration system behind Nexus East is City of Austin property, and Nexus East is responsible for landscaping maintenance, pollution control, and ensuring controlled access.  It is not - and has never been - a dog park, dog run, or amenity for residents, regardless of what previous management may have incorrectly told you. The City of Austin placed a placard stating that the area is not for public access, and we have locked the gates due to repeated unauthorized resident access to the area. We take our responsibility to the City of Austin seriously, as well as the overall maintenance of Nexus East, which is why the area has been secured. 

With respect to your concerns regarding security, we are working to replace our pedestrian gate locks which have been previously replaced several times this year, and we work on a daily and weekly basis to ensure that the vehicle gates are operating correctly as well as the rest of the access points within the property. 

Please feel free to reach out to us directly regarding your concerns and we will be happy to address them with you further. Thank you for your continued feedback and helping us ensure Nexus East is a comfortable place to live, and we hope to hear from you soon.

reviews.author: Megan Holgerson
reviews.text: This community is so beautiful and well managed by Valerie! I am happy to call this place home. :)
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 6 months ago
Thank you for your review! We're thrilled you find our community beautiful! Welcome home!

reviews.author: Dennis Britton
reviews.text:
CHOOSE SOMEWHERE ELSE!

I usually give places the benefit of the doubt, but this was a really awful experience at these apartments. The staff is constantly changing. Some are very nice, but there are some VERY rude members even when you are trying to be polite and cordial.

The apartments are new, but are very cheaply made. The cabinets and doors are thin and easily broken. The large sinks are not set right so they do not drain and accumulate water and grime. The washing machine sets off the breaker every other time, so if you try doing a was while gone or over night you will find your clothes sitting, submerged in water. Insects and bugs are everywhere. They fill the semi-open air stairwells. The stairwells are NEVER cleaned of trash, spills, or spiderwebs. In 2 bedrooms the AC is near the guest room and gets that room very cold while the rest of the apartment gets no AC. No vent valves to redirect air.

Then there are the Air B&Bers. The apartment puts up its own units on air b&b for extra income. This means that there is a constant flow of travelers who get locked outside, trash the stairwells and hallways, and never put their trash out right so that the trash service won't take it and it will sit there in the hallways with nothing done to it for weeks. They also bring their dogs which have attacked other tenants with no repercussions

Finally, when I moved out they sent me a bill for $1400 owed after deposit. I used a cleaning service, but they charged me with $200 "Heavy Cleaning" fee and $750 for new carpet and padding. There was absolutely nothing wrong with the carpet.

This was one of the most disappointing rental experiences I have ever had. The Nexus is WAYYY over priced for what you get. I would pick the next apartment on your list.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 3 years ago
Dennis, your feedback is appreciated. It’s certainly not our intention to mislead our customers, so we apologize for any confusion. We’d be happy to speak with you and answer any questions you may have so please contact us at nexuseast@avenue5apt.com or +1 512-389-5369. We work hard to provide our customers with the best support and we hope you will give us another opportunity to show you that.

reviews.author: Ty Sakakeeny
reviews.text: I was hesitant about moving here given the negative reviews in the past but I can honestly say this is an absolutely amazing place to live. Top notch amenities, great location (yes it’s on a tollway but also really close to a lot of cool spots) and the management has been awesome. Kiah was super helpful with introducing us to the apartment and she and Christian have been amazing at helping us with any issues. There’s a really great community here and we’re really happy to have chosen nexus!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 2 years ago
Hi Ty Sakakeeny, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at Nexus East. We're happy we could meet your expectations!

reviews.author: Laura Vinson
reviews.text: I toured this property last week and the amenities are amazing! The pool is gigantic and perfect for ATX summers! The staff was very friendly and informative!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 9 months ago
Your positive experience at Nexus East is truly valued. Thank you for highlighting our amazing amenities and friendly staff!

reviews.author: Sean
reviews.text:
I've lived here for a couple of months now and generally really like it. My biggest complaint, though, is that the walls/floors seem like they are almost literally paper thin. I can hear nearly everything as if it were basically in my apartment--regular/speaking conversations, dogs, alarms, people walking in the hallways outside, and, uhh, you know, "bedroom festivities". And that means everyone else can hear the same from me too, so I feel like I have very little privacy here because of it.

Otherwise, it's been great, though—great location, amenities, staff, etc.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner Edited 2 years ago
Thank you again for taking the time to let us know how we did. We hope you have a great day!

reviews.author: Daniel B
reviews.text:
Great staff.

But managed by Greystar now, so def $ over everything at the end of the day. Lease renewal is significantly more than the online prices. So just have a backup plan come renewal time.

To the response: its been 2 years, not nearly 3. Avenue 5 managed on 10/2022.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner a year ago
Hi Daniel,

Thanks for your feedback. Management hasn't changed in nearly 3 years and I'd love to share some additional perks you can receive by living at  Greystar property! Also, we are aware that the rental market has changed when it comes to pricing due to all of the new developments in the area. We are actually working with many residents and negotiating their renewal rents to be more in line with online pricing! Happy to discuss your renewal options with you if you are approaching renewal or when that time comes. Feel free to email me at ana.wright@greystar.com . Thanks!

reviews.author: Grace Goldstein

reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 8 months ago

reviews.author: Kathrine Harrington
reviews.text: I recently toured with Chelsey and loved her professionalism and personality! The community is gorgeous and although our plans have changed and we will no longer be moving, she was an incredible leasing professional and deserves the recognition. Out of all the places we toured this was by far our favorite! Definitely recommending to our friends looking to move to the area.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 2 years ago
Hi Kathrine Harrington, we are very happy Chelsey provided you with such a positive experience! If you need anything in the future, please feel free to contact us!

reviews.author: Alecia
reviews.text:
Run as fast as you can away from this place.

- Vehicle vandalization and theft continuously ( people steal catalytic converter, rims, tires)
- growing algae in pool
- packages stolen
- one of the gates always broken
- the tag to enter the building is useless. They said it would cost $10k to fix and it’s not worked in 1 year.
- homeless people always around in the lobby and sleeping in there
- there is no patrol security like they claim. They even gave us a number to them in case of anything suspicious and it was not in service
- Airbnb units all over the building
- rover runs rampant in the building. So expect barking or meowing all the time.
- no parking for tenants. Not enough parking. Good luck finding a spot.
- always new lease agents every week
- poop everywhere around the building
- cockroaches

Oh and the positive comments you see on here. They were asking tenants to post and would be offered a visa gift card.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 2 years ago
Julie Ward, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. I want to speak to you more about your review, but I am not seeing you in our system as a resident. We do have patrol and I will reach out to them regarding their number not working. As for Rover this is a dog walking service and residents are free to use them if they need to as we are a pet friendly community. Per the history of the community, we did have concerns with AirBnB but weekly we check to see if there are any posted and give violations. We do offer corporate leasing with vetted companies you may see these residents coming in. I would love to discuss more if you can please reach out to us. 

Thank you, 
Nakeiya Espinosa
512-389-5369

reviews.author: Dana Scholten
reviews.text: I really do enjoy living here but recently they’ve been making decisions that have really upset the residents. Like just the other day they closed the dog park to all residents, claiming it was never meant to be a dog park despite being advertised to us as so and never sending any emails explaining to residents that it’s off limits prior to the decision to close it. And then when I commented on their most recent Instagram post promoting their pet-friendly complex, I commented saying how they closed the big dog park and that the small dog park doesn’t even have real grass. They then deleted the comment and turned off all comments for that post. Very disappointing.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 3 years ago
Dana, we are so excited that you love the new coffee machine!! -Nexus East Management Team

reviews.author: Maca Sanchez
reviews.text: Claudio was amazing! Super helpful and answered all my questions. Unlike a community near by also on 183 frontage rd, where they weren’t helpful in answering my questions
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 6 months ago
We are excited to hear that Claudio was amazing and helpful during your visit. Thank you for sharing your experience with us!

reviews.author: Atharv Vij
reviews.text:
New management is really bad about responding to requests and incidents at the apartment complex.

We’ve had people’s cars vandalized, wheels stolen, windshields broken and management doesn’t seem to care about any of these incidents. Prior management worked with a security patrol company and they would make routine drives across the property to reduce these issues but the new management hasn’t done anything of the sort.

Office/property management takes forever to address minor issues. I feel like I have to constantly follow up or my issues won’t get addressed. It’s taken 4 months to register my toll tag (still hasn’t been done after multiple emails and in person follow ups) and I’ve been without a functioning dishwasher for 2 weeks. Every time I call, the management says they’ll get back to me and then I don’t ever hear back from them.
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 2 years ago
Hi there, I would like to get some more details about your experience with us. Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (512) 389-5369. We look forward to hearing from you.

reviews.author: Vanessa Tyscka
reviews.text: This place looks nice on the surface but it is a nightmare. My daughter has rented here for almost a year now and it has been one problem after another. 2 major floods (she lives on the bottom floor) due to upstairs units having pipe breaks and toilet issues. More often than not she has to live in inhumane conditions such as loud fans for water and mold remediation 24-7, construction work tearing out walls etc. The management wouldn’t pay for a hotel the first time it flooded. second time they offered a smaller apt that is not large enough for their furniture (her and her roommate work from home). Packages are frequently stolen. You will get late fees and eviction notices if the payment portal is down. Pathetic excuse for an apartment complex. Save yourself a lot of headaches and try to find a better managed apartment if you can!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner a year ago
Hello Vanessa, thank you for your comments regarding this incident. We take all feedback very seriously here, especially when related to a water leak like this. We have been working since this incident occurred to assist your daughter to the best of our ability and make this right. While we cannot provide you directly with additional details, we are moving her to a larger unit - not a smaller one - for the time being, and she will be able to return to her original unit as requested once repairs are completed.

We understand that this is a difficult and stressful situation and want the process to move as quickly and smoothly as possible. We welcome you and your daughter to reach out to us at our office regarding further concerns so that we can address them while we work to resolve this and will do what we can to assist. We greatly appreciate your feedback, and it is our goal and intent to make every resident experience here at Nexus East as high-quality as possible, even when incidents like this happen.

reviews.author: Brittany Bogard
reviews.text:
When I first moved in back Sept 2021 it was a perfectly fine place to live and living in a brand new unit was really nice. As time has moved on and new management has taken over the building my experience and living situation here has drastically diminished.
- I have barely had hot water and lacking water pressure at times to my apt going on about two months now
- I can't turn on my hair dryer with both bathroom lights on without my fuse breaking every single time (have to use dimmed light with only 1 on)
- the layout in the  1bd has a funky layout where the two bathroom doors collide into each other.
- this community does NOT provide lock out help outside of business hours. Their response/advice to residents is don't lose or have your property stolen/taken.
- this is an airbnb heavy community which can raise safety and noise concerns
- cars have been broken into
- package rooms have been broken into

Honestly some of these things are whatever and I can deal with and have, but as the list keeps growing they are beginning to snowball and create a horrible living experience that is now starting to impact daily life (NO HOT WATER)
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 3 years ago
Hi Brittany,

We sincerely regret that your experience has been less than perfect. We care deeply about our resident's feedback and want to provide the most comfortable living possible. We hope you give us another chance soon, so we can share a more positive experience. I would love the opportunity to meet with you and chat about  the items you have listed. Please contact me at pm.nexuseast@avenue5apt.com or call the office at 512.389.5369 and ask for Jessica E. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best,

Jessica Esparza, Community Manager

reviews.author: Olivia
reviews.text: BELIEVE ALL THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS!!! I had high humidity in my unit and the Manager kept telling me 80% was normal. She had an a/c company come out and test it and even argued with him and refused to do anything about it. Thank God I was …

Response from the owner 5 months ago

reviews.author: Richard Pollard
reviews.text: I've had a great experience at the nexus east. Kylee is very her team are very professional and  ready to help you with anything you need regarding your apartment. Best management team I've experienced. The maintenance team is also very …
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 4 years ago
Hi, Richard. We are always excited when our residents let us know that our team made a positive impact on their living experience in our community. Our number one goal is customer satisfaction and reviews like yours let us know we are succeeding. We appreciate you!

reviews.author: Alejandro Romo
reviews.text: I had an amazing experience touring, Termisha was so nice and accomodating and it's definitely influenced how I feel about this place!
reviews.response_text:
Response from the owner 8 months ago
We're overjoyed to hear about your amazing experience during the tour with Termisha. Thank you immensely for sharing your positive feedback with us!

reviews.text: Current resident. The office manager Richie is phenomenal and the maintenance team is wonderful and very on top of any maintenance request we’ve had. The pool is always kept very clean and overall it’s been an enjoyable Living experience.

reviews.author: Angela Burgess
reviews.text:
I applied to this complex on July 29th. I provided all documentation up front and still had no decision by the 11th of August. I applied somewhere else and sent my new address to the property manager on the 12th requesting my refund be sent and received no response.

I called several times at which I was ignored. I then called from a different phone number right after which was prompt answered. The manager tells me that they only send out requests twice a month. This was a new to me, as I asked how long it would take to receive my money back and was told within 14 days and no mention of when it would be requested which to me should have been immediately since it was taking so long to get a decision.

I've contacted their corporate office on my own instead of trusting an email with one person's name because I have absolutely no trust in what I've been told, and am angered by the treatment and holding of my funds. 14 days is up!
Hopefully the management company will follow up.

I only came to this property because I was told they would work with me. This property is barely maintained, trash in the walk ways along with other undesirable elements and have the nerve to keep me waiting as if this is some gem of a property, and is a far far cry from anything such.

This is my experience getting the runaround with the property manager there, whose name is Richie. I don't know if this is standard business practice for AMC Properties but he is the only one that I have seen at this property so there was no hope for a better experience with any other agent.
reviews.response_text: Angela, The payment you provided was a holding fee, not a security deposit. As soon as you informed us that you were no longer interested in moving forward, we began the process for a refund. As we discussed, this process does take some time to complete, but it is currently underway.

reviews.author: Michelle Salas
reviews.text: I am a new renter at this complex and I could not have been any happier with my choice. The property manager Richy was super friendly and helpful with every step of my move in process. When I first toured the complex, I noticed right away how nice and clean the property was, especially the pool! And once we went into the apartment unit I was going to be renting, I knew this was going to be the perfect place for me. The apartment is newly remodeled and even smelled so clean, really felt like home already. I can gladly say I would 100% recommend this complex for any future renters.
reviews.response_text: We appreciate your positive feedback! Thank you for recommending us—it’s great to know you're having a wonderful experience in our community.

reviews.author: Tonya Miller
reviews.text: They have a nice pool and its pet friendly
reviews.response_text: Thanks for the kind words! We’re so glad you're enjoying your stay. If there’s anything we can do to make your experience perfect and push us to a 5-star rating, we’d love to hear your ideas!

reviews.author: Nicholas Tsubenko
reviews.text: I’m very satisfied with my moving-in experience. The process was quick and smooth, and Richy was always responsive and helpful with any questions I had. The apartment is clean and comfortable, and the complex is well-managed, showing real care for the residents. Richy’s support and promptness made my transition as easy as possible. I highly recommend this place!!
reviews.response_text: Thank you for your kind words! We're glad you're enjoying your home and our community. We strive to make every resident feel comfortable and happy—thanks for being part of it!

reviews.text: Awesome office staff. Property manager is chill, and down to earth. Rule of thumb until you meet someone for the first time, don’t go based off what you’re hearing. Blanket statement. Okay, I’m logged off.

reviews.author: Ling C
reviews.text:
6/30/24 UPDATE: The entire complex is in disarray, heaps of dog poop EVERYWHERE, Kids toys, Trash, bird poop covering stairs, Lights knocked over, Broken lights, If you own a vehicle, You’ll soon realize why EVERY vehicle has a theft proof cover over their license plate, One of the Tenants that’s lived here as long as I have, Stole my tag and put it on his vehicle. Then aggressively confronted us for calling the cops on his poor choices. Its the weekend before 4th of July and our pool is neon green, Again. Palm Tree seed pods are covering the pool. If this place was maintained properly, They would know Palm Trees need to be trimmed before they start to seed or it can cause bigger problems. 6/19/2023 UPDATE: It’s Monday and Richie can’t seem to answer the phone. SHOCKER! We just passed Father’s Day weekend with a green pool- OUR ONLY AMENITY we pay for looks like shrecks swamp water. We have broken parking lot lights that have been like this for over a month, That could cause serious injury. Talking with a neighbor, Turns out we don’t have a maintenance man either!!!! Pathetic…. Allll these issues and the office manager trots around telling everyone he now lives on property, all while he literally can’t even answer the phone, Nor take care of the property.

11/3/22 UPDATE: Bianca the so called “office lady” STILL won’t answer the phone NOR follow up with broken appliances. THEY DONT FIX ANYTHING. Can you say GHETTO?  Now owned by a NEW OWNER. We were notified by once again, Changing the requirements of HOW we pay rent, Keep in mind it’s costing extra just TO GET RENT PAID. I am in a Lease, The new company is charging extra. As for Jasmine Womack’s review, You give a place that has ROACHES 3 stars? Ew. Have a higher expectations.

This property does not value the tenants that reside here. Every month it’s a huge hassle to even pay rent. They keep changing what kind of payment they will accept, with that every month each method has hidden fees. They are essentially pushing us to have no other option than Auto-Pay. I could see using Auto pay if this was a luxury apartment, but we pay for a green pool, no gym or grills & unimaginable dirty property. See pics below for proof. We pay over $1500 a month for a neon green pool.(Dont forget the hidden fees to even pay your rent)  I asked temp office manager as to why we don’t have a gym when there’s been a gym here for over 10 years, What WAS a gym is now turned into a dirty storage room. Bianca the new office manager is quite literally useless. She doesn’t answer numerous phone calls, nor emails I’ve sent.

reviews.author: Wanda Ward
reviews.text: I have been a residence for 5 years. I can’t get anything fixed! The last management was better. Things got done around here. Ricky does not appreciate the residence that’s been here. We are not of value.  The rent continues to go up! I’ve been trying to get things fixed/replaced for 2 years now. How sad! You do inspections and see that things need to be fixed and replaced but nothing gets done! Like, what’s the reason for the inspection???????? Make it make sense. I have called and called and called and emailed and all I get is the runaround.
reviews.response_text: Hello Wanda Ward, we want to understand your disappointment. It’s important to us that our customers are more than satisfied and we would like the opportunity to resolve this issue immediately. If you give us a chance, our intent is focused on making this right and hope you will allow us to speak with you to discuss the situation. Please reach out to us at your earliest convenience.

reviews.author: Hoolia Hathaway
reviews.response_text: Thanks for the awesome rating, Hoolia! We're glad The Northern Apartments has been meeting your needs and that you're enjoying your stay here! If there is anything we can do to earn that extra star and create a true, 5-star experience for you, please let us know!

reviews.text: Nice, quiet, but way to my dogs. It's a bonus to have a washer and dryer in the unit.
reviews.response_text: We appreciate you sharing the wonderful rating with us, Kim! If you ever need help from our team here at The Northern Apartments or have any additional feedback for us, please don't hesitate to reach out at any time – we're always happy to help!

reviews.author: Jonathan Kamarata
reviews.text: Went to check out apartments as a potential renter both with and without appointment ; I went several different days at different times and; never seen a single person at the front office because nobody was ever there.  They never picked up the phones or anything. I just can't help but feel if this is the kind of service they offer to potential renters it must be twice as frustrating for people who live there.
reviews.response_text:
Hi Jonathan,
I am sorry for your latest experience with us. We invite you to contact us so we may discuss your specific personal experience. Thank you!

reviews.author: Miles Howard
reviews.text: I’ve been living here for three years first and foremost. Secondly, I want to give the leasing manager Richie a shout out without him and the staff of this complex. I think this would be a regular apartment complex. Thirdly, I want to thank Richie again for being patient, considerate and understanding throughout my years of living here. I have had a couple rough patches.  Richie and the staff have been very responsive to my needs for maintenance and other concerns. I have seen so much growth in this complex throughout all my years of living here. That growth has come with a strong staff lead by Richie and I want to thank him and the staff for all the hard work in maintaining this growing community within this complex.

Richey does a great job. Very attentive, responsive and all around runs a huge complex - more people should be considerate of this! As for myself and my family, we appreciate the experience of living here so far.

Apartment is disgusting.
The pool is green and maintenance never comes. When you call the office Richie never answers... I'm not happy with the quality of care that the Northern Apartments has with their tenants. You would think for how much it is that we would be provided with basic maintenance upkeep.
