reviews.author: Ashley Koch
reviews.text: I’ve lived here for almost a year now and have had a great experience. Maintenance always replies on time and management is super helpful. It’s been a way better property since switching from Greystar. Perfect if you’re a grad student or looking for a quiet area.
reviews.response_text: Thank you immensely for sharing your positive experience! We're glad our maintenance team and management have been helpful during your year here.

reviews.author: Morgan Breheny
reviews.text: I’ve had a great experience living here. The building is well maintained, clean, and feels very safe, which made a big difference for me. The new management has been consistently friendly, professional, and responsive whenever I’ve had questions or needed help. You can tell they genuinely care about the residents.
reviews.response_text: We are elated to hear about your positive experience! Thank you for recognizing our team's care and professionalism.

reviews.author: sara bonilla
reviews.text: My husband and i have lived here for about a year and a half and we have enjoyed every second! We moved here from across the country - never saw the apartment, signed a lease and committed to this community and we have never looked back! We love how quick we are able to communicate with staff and we are really enjoying the new Kairoi management! The amenities are always clean and the coffee bar has been restocked better and better! Heights cares for its residents as best as it can - and we are super grateful!
reviews.response_text: Thank you immensely for choosing Heights at Interlocken! We're thrilled you love our community, team communication, and featured items.

reviews.author: Kathleen Smith
reviews.text: There are a considerable number of owners with reactive dogs on the property; therefore, big piles of dog crap lay along the sidewalks. dog urine stains the front entrances and grounds. fire alarms wake you up monthly.  Not worth the luxury prices currently. It feels like if I paid less, then I wouldn’t care about how stinky and loud this property can be. I moved from a non luxury property, to this luxury property, and Heights simply reeks of dog waste. I’m sorry, but given how animals carry disease, this needs to improve immediately. Thank you.
reviews.response_text:
Thank you for sharing your feedback. We understand your concerns and apologize for the disruptions you’ve experienced.

We take pet waste and cleanliness across the community very seriously. Maintaining a clean and sanitary environment is a shared responsibility, and our team actively enforces pet policies, increases grounds monitoring, and responds promptly when concerns are reported. We also encourage residents to report issues as they see them so they can be addressed quickly.

Regarding the fire alarm activation on January 12, the system detected a change in water pressure within the building’s fire suppression system and activated as a safety precaution. The system responded exactly as designed. Our team promptly investigated, confirmed there was no fire or danger, and verified that all systems were functioning properly. At no point were residents at risk. Management is actively working with our service providers to address the underlying cause and reduce the likelihood of future false activations. Resident safety remains our top priority, and we appreciate everyone’s patience as we continue to ensure the reliability of our life-safety systems.

We understand the expectations that come with a luxury community and regret that your experience has not met them. Your feedback is important to us, and we remain committed to making continued improvements.

We’d be happy to speak with you in person to address your concerns. Please reach out at 303-522-5943 or heightsinterlocken@kairoi.com.

– The Team at Heights at Interlocken

reviews.text: The new management team here has been great. Anthony and Samantha have really made a difference in how it feels to live here. I really appreciate everything they’ve done.
reviews.response_text: Thank you so much for the kind words! We truly appreciate you taking the time to leave such a thoughtful review. It means a lot to hear that you’ve felt a positive difference, and we’re really glad to know our efforts are making an impact. We genuinely care about our residents and love being part of a community where people feel supported and heard. Thank you again, we’re grateful to have you here!

reviews.response_text: We're absolutely thrilled to hear about your positive experience at Heights at Interlocken. Thank you for sharing your feedback!

reviews.author: Jasper choi
reviews.text:
This is my 4th year at the heights and the Kairoi management team has been a great help so far with no real issues to note. I was particularly impressed by Samantha as she was a true professional with her job and strives for nothing below excellent service to help out all residents the best she can. I also give thanks to the rest of the team such as Anthony, the lady at the front, and the maintenance team who has been nothing but timely with all requests up until now. I am hopeful this management team will continue taking care of the heights to the best of their ability.

This building is old, fire alarms continue to be an infrastructure problem management and residents have to deal with, but all things considered I think this is still a great place to live at. The views continue to take my breath away, and though I wish the trash rooms would be cleaner at times I am still happy to be living at the heights.

We are truly grateful you have been part of this community for the past three years. Please rest assured that earlier this year, we addressed other concerns regarding the fire system to ensure safety and comfort for all residents. We deeply appreciate any feedback you may have regarding our team. We strive every day to ensure the satisfaction and well-being of our residents.

Heights at Interlocken

reviews.author: Hope Ward
reviews.text:
12/1/25: Fire alarms still not fixed. First cold night of this winter season and they’re back on at 5:30am. Don’t ignore this review and think it will get fixed by the time you move in. I’ve lived here 3 years. Residents and pets traumatized.

12/16/25: Fire alarms triggered yet again. Apparently testing was being done but no email was sent to the community. We are under a fire watch weather warning, and a notice would have helped a ton.
reviews.response_text:
Hi Hope,

Thank you for sharing this. I’m truly sorry you’ve experienced fire alarm issues in the past. I understand how stressful that can be for you and your pets. While we understand there were previous concerns with the fire alarm system, I want to assure you that all necessary precautions were taken to fully address and resolve those issues. We’re happy to report those efforts were successful, and the incident that occurred was an isolated event related to a resident cooking in their kitchen. We also sent a same-day email update to the entire community to keep everyone informed about what happened.

My name is Samantha, the new Community Director, and I’m committed to making our community a comfortable, and enjoyable place for you and your neighbors. Please feel free to reach out to me directly at 303-552-5943 if you’d like to discuss this further or need any additional clarification.

Also, when you have a moment, please stop by our Paws & Perks Bar in the office. I’d love to meet you, and we have a treat waiting for your little one 🐾

Thank you again for your feedback, Hope. We truly appreciate you being part of our community.

reviews.text: This complex just wants more money for an old building and doesn’t want to update anything. Also, it costs extra money per month to get into the garage. However, they recently added more reserved spots (extra $$ on top of just getting into the garage, and takes spots that I can use) and now I can’t get a spot in the garage even though I pay monthly for it even though all the reserved spots are empty. This is ridiculous and I wouldn’t recommend this complex to anyone who doesn’t want to be exploited for less than the bare minimum. Take the tour, it’s obvious they don’t keep up on this complex unless it gives them more money.

reviews.author: Ryan Connell
reviews.text: Wanted to give a shout out to the staff working to make this place a home for many of us. I see Olga the unstoppable cleaning machine working hard to keep the common areas looking good despite some of our sloppy residents and she's always friendly to the residents and their pets in the hallways. Brad has been a great manager to talk to about any challenges that pop up and he's a lot more present around the building than a lot of our past managers. Jim, Kassandra, and Steph have been really helpful as well over the past couple years and a friendly face when stopping by the leasing office. Maintenance has been responsive and effective, good enough in fact that I haven't gotten to know their names yet given how infrequently we need their help. As an example we had an appliance break a few weeks ago and there was a brand new appliance in its place by the end of the day. It's beautiful here and the management team is great, but keep in mind the building itself isn't perfect. Most notably foundation settling challenges, water leaks, fire alarms, and a pool that seems to scheme all winter of new issues to delay its opening in the summer. The team is working though to make things better and overall the Greystar team has been a significant improvement over some of our past management teams both in person and the effect they're having on taking on some of the bigger issues the building has had over the years. Thank you! :-)

reviews.author: alyssa podlaski
reviews.text:
I am a new Tenant moving in in the next two weeks. So far, my experience with the leasing office has been WONDERFUL! Hillary has been so helpful and patient with me while getting her all the necessary information to move in. She provided me with any answers to my questions and made this process so smooth. She gave a great tour with lots of info about the unit and neighborhood. I am very much looking forward to calling AMLI at Interlocken, home. :) Thanks again Hilary!

UPDATE 8/9/24 AMLI sold the building to Greystar and everything has drastically gone down hill. Something is always broken, fire alarm has gone off 4 dozen times in the 4 years I’ve lived here. Work orders take over two months to be completed. Communication with the leasing office and residences are a joke. I’ve called and email the office to speak to a manager a handful of times and nobody has emailed me or called me back. Genuinely used to love living here, place has really sucked lately.

UPDATE 9/24/24 - building is continuing to go down hill. Pool was opened late 3 years in a show (lucky if we got the pool for two months of summer) now greystar is charging $30 a month TO PARK WHERE WE LIVE, with AMLI first car was free. We didn’t have 24/7 access to the package room for about 8+ months and was only able to get packages during business hours. Front office doesn’t update us on changes. Expect new random charges on your account every month. They are now charging ALL residents for electric and gas in the “common areas” which is complete BS. Place is terrible. As other people stated, the fire alarm goes off ALL the time for the most random things. We all have covered the speakers in our units with tape and dish towels to muffle the sound. The other new thing was they replaced my hot water heater - great. I get home and all my lights are on (did it while I was at work) whatever no big deal but then I’m sitting half nude in my own home and hear a knock at the door and then not even a few seconds later, keys entering the lock. I run over to the door and open it to find a man I have never seen in my life. They gave a key to my unit to a VENDOR. Not employed by heights at interlocken and there was no heights maintenance person with them. So two strange men were at my door. As a single women living alone - this is NOT okay.

2/24/25 - it hasn’t gotten any better. Just do yourself a favor and don’t move here. The fire alarm goes off every other week - so much so that a large majority of the tenants have tapped dishrags over the speakers to muffle the debilitating sound, management sends emails threatening tenants rather than encouraging us. There’s dog poop everywhere. They have NEVER stuck to a deadline ever, garage doors are always breaking (you pay $30-$50 to park in there), some of the entry doors to the building you can just pull right open! Mind you, this is supposed to be a secure community. I’ve been here since 2020, I truly used to love living here. Now I can’t wait to move.
reviews.response_text:
Hello!

Thank you for sharing your feedback. We genuinely apologize for the challenges you've experienced during your time here, especially with issues like the fire alarm, security concerns, and garage door maintenance. We understand how these ongoing problems can be frustrating, and we truly regret that we have not met your expectations in these areas.

We take all feedback seriously and are actively working on improving these issues, including addressing maintenance concerns more efficiently. Your experience is not the standard we aim for, and we value your input as we strive to enhance the living environment for all residents.

We appreciate you being part of our community since 2020, and we are sorry to hear you're considering leaving. If there's anything further you'd like to discuss or if we can assist in making your remaining time here more comfortable, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Heights at Interlocken

reviews.author: Jay Kuhns
reviews.response_text:
Good morning!

We sincerely regret any frustration you may have experienced due to the recent alarm system activations within our community. We’d like to offer clarification on the circumstances behind each incident:

The most recent alarm activation was due to an actual minor fire caused by a tenant. The alarm system responded appropriately, as designed, to ensure safety.

The two earlier alarm activations occurred due to frozen pipes that burst during freezing temperatures and inclement weather, which led to reduced water pressure in the sprinkler lines.

Please be assured that we are diligently working to address these issues and improve the overall reliability of our systems. Your feedback is valuable, and we are here to discuss any further concerns you may have.

Thank you for your understanding, and we appreciate your patience.

Heights at Interlocken

reviews.author: Theresa Giorgio (thatdarntheresa)
reviews.text:
Maintenance left a mess after fixing my washing machine, and didn’t even plug it back in. I tried calling the office and no one answered. I tried calling emergency maintenance and the mailbox is full. I went down to the lobby and it was unlocked and empty. I looked, and the leasing agent left her computer unlocked. Stuff like this happens to everyone who lives here, every day, regardless of what the review bots hired by greystar say.

I AM NOT COMFORTABLE WITH MY PERSONAL DATA BEING HERE FOR THE TAKING. DO BETTER.
reviews.response_text:
Morning!

Thank you for sharing your feedback in regard to your unit. For clarification, the incident of your appliances is not related to our maintenance staff. Vendors were onsite to complete your request. After this matter was brought to our attention when you stopped by over the weekend, the vendors were then contacted to return and complete this matter accordingly.

As far as other matters are concerned, someone will be reaching out to you to address this further.

Heights at Interlocken

reviews.author: Matthew Adams
reviews.text:
Fire alarms constantly going off for no reason. Like Tyler said, there appears to just be little accountability for the experience advertised.

These seem to be a lot of fake reviews here, so please trust that absolutely nobody who lives here is giving the property 5 stars.

Management are habitual liars who will say anything to shirk responsibility for their very simple jobs of maintaining the property, like keeping fire exits clear of obstructions. Things are constantly broken and nobody seems to care, unless of course it might impact their ability to entrap prospective residents.
reviews.response_text:
Thank you for sharing your concerns. We genuinely apologize for the frustration you've encountered with the fire alarms and maintenance issues. We understand how disruptive the constant alarms can be, and we are actively investigating the cause to ensure that any underlying issues are resolved promptly.

Regarding your comments about accountability and property maintenance, we take these matters seriously and are committed to providing a safe, clean, and well-maintained living environment for all of our residents. If there are any ongoing issues with fire exits or broken amenities, we will prioritize addressing them to ensure they meet safety and operational standards.

We also understand the importance of transparency, and we regret that you feel your experience hasn’t reflected the quality of service we strive to provide. Please know that all feedback—positive or negative—is invaluable to us, and we use it to continuously improve our processes. We encourage you to reach out to us directly if you'd like to discuss your concerns further or if there’s anything we can do to help resolve these issues.

Thank you again for your feedback, and we hope to have the opportunity to make things right.

reviews.author: Jovonne Thomas
reviews.text: 5 Stars !! Estela and Julieta Rock!!
reviews.response_text: Your review is appreciated! Estela and Julieta truly rock at Eden Keller Ranch. Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us.

reviews.author: Ashraf Mohammed
reviews.text: I recently moved into the community and Everything has been wonderful so far. Julieta made the entire process incredibly easy and stress-free. I truly appreciate how helpful she was with sharing all the necessary information and ensuring I had everything I needed to get settled in comfortably.
reviews.response_text: We deeply cherish your feedback! Thrilled Julieta made your move stress-free and comfortable. Welcome to our community!

reviews.author: Adam
reviews.text: Easy and smooth, a cool environment.
reviews.response_text: We're ecstatic to hear you had an easy and smooth experience at Eden Keller Ranch. Thank you for your feedback!

reviews.author: Jaden Wilson
reviews.text: Everyone here was great! Estella & Julieta were very patient and helpful they took really good care of us and got us moved in very quickly. Very upfront and honest with the pricing and even took time out of their way to even reply back to us and help us after hours too. I recommend this place to anyone who’s looking to move it’s very convenient, quiet, clean, and the staff is all great. Great amenities too.
reviews.response_text: Thank you for sharing your wonderful feedback about Estella and Julieta! We appreciate you recommending our community.

reviews.author: Avis
reviews.text: My daughter shared with me she was given a lease violation from her brother who is my son for visiting her for 15min.. I feel this is a inappropriate lease violation for someone visiting.. the matter was not investigated just a violation.. I feel due to discrimination of my daughters race the matter was not looked into further.. avoid this place if you want peace and want relationships with your family members.. not a family oriented place to be or raise children.. save yourself the humiliation and headache from dealing with racist office personnel
reviews.response_text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We take all concerns seriously, especially those involving how policies are applied and how residents and their guests are treated. Our community policies are intended to be applied consistently and respectfully, and discrimination of any kind is not tolerated. If this interaction felt otherwise, we want the opportunity to better understand what occurred.
Because online forums don’t always allow for a full review of the facts, we would appreciate the chance to discuss this matter directly and look into it further. Please contact our management office so we can review the situation and address your concerns appropriately. We value our residents and strive to foster a respectful and welcoming community. Thank you again for bringing this to our attention.

reviews.author: Donel
reviews.text: If you are of color do not move here.. I visited my sister for 15min and she got a lease violation for unauthorized occupant.. mind you this is my first time visiting and was only here for 15min.. she told me they typed her up a lease violation.. what is the point of visitors parking if you cnt have visitors.. very unprofessional and unfair to the residents.. there was no investigation just automatic lease violation.. I will continue to post reviews based on the treatment of my sister.. DO NOT MOVE HERE‼️‼️‼️👀
reviews.response_text: We’re sorry to hear that this experience was frustrating for you and your sister, and we understand how upsetting it can feel when a situation is unexpected or unclear. Our community policies regarding guests and occupancy are intended to be applied consistently and are never based on race or personal characteristics. Discrimination of any kind is not tolerated. If this interaction came across as unfair or unprofessional, we take that seriously and would like the opportunity to review what occurred. Lease notices are typically generated based on reported activity and do not represent a final determination without review. Because online platforms don’t allow us to discuss specific details, we encourage your sister to contact our management office directly in person so we can fully address any misunderstandings. We value respectful communication and strive to maintain a welcoming community for all residents and their families. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

reviews.author: Ari Love
reviews.text:
If you are of color meaning “BLACK” I would NOT  move here, I recently had a fire inspector enter my KITCHEN to change a fire extinguisher green tag &  went to the front office to advice my home smelled like smoke and lied stating he seen residents other than myself in my home.. it’s the holidays my brother lives directly right next door and was visiting me with his son .. 1st off how can someone  briefly step inside your home & assume who lives there ? Secondly are we not allowed to have visitors in the home we rent month to month? Thirdly I have so many candle warmers in my home there is NO WAY POSSIBLE SMOKE WAS SMELLED IN MY HOME & I DONT SMOKE .. I would never suggest anyone moving here they gave me a lease violation for no proof just he say she say and I feel that is racist because I am the only black person in my building blame it on the “black woman”, I feel so uncomfortable I been here 2 months and I am breaking my lease asap !!

& to top that off the fire inspector forgot to mention my fire alarm is broke in this unit but he mentioned all other lies to them .. how sway of that! Save your money !!
reviews.response_text:
Thank you for sharing your experience. We want to be clear that discrimination of any kind is not tolerated in our community. Our policies and inspections are intended to ensure safety and compliance for all residents and are never based on race or personal characteristics. If your experience felt otherwise, we take that concern very seriously.  If there were misunderstandings, incorrect information shared, or maintenance issues—such as a non-functioning fire alarm—this should be reported by the resident to management immediately upon noticing that your device is not working properly.  Because we cannot discuss specific lease matters publicly, we strongly encourage you to contact the management office directly in person so we can thoroughly discuss your concerns and work toward a resolution. Our goal is for every resident to feel safe, respected, and comfortable in their home.
Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

reviews.author: Sergio Llamas
reviews.text: Moved in here about 6 months ago when it was still Elan Keller, the new management team is very friendly. The transition was causing a lot of movement but the leasing office stayed on top of everything. Mr. Ben Willis has been very helpful in multiple occasions. So far so good
reviews.response_text:
Thank you so much for sharing your experience! We’re thrilled to hear that your past six months have been positive and that the transition has felt smooth for you. Our team truly appreciates your kind words!

We’re especially glad to hear that Ben has been such a help — he’s a rockstar, and we’ll be sure to share your shout-out with him!

Thank you again for taking the time to leave this review. We’re grateful to have you here and are excited to continue providing you with a great living experience!

reviews.author: Amanda Feniza
reviews.text: We loved living here aside from my husband's motorcycle being stolen out of this GATED apartment complex.... gates are supposed to be closed for a reason.
reviews.response_text:
Thank you for sharing your feedback. We’re truly sorry to hear about the situation with your husband’s motorcycle — we understand how upsetting and frustrating that must have been.

Since the recent management change, we have not been made aware of any recent reports regarding a motorcycle theft, but we take concerns like this very seriously. 

Regarding the gate, we completely understand your concern. Our access gate system is currently in the process of being upgraded to a new platform, and delays have occurred due to software changes with the new vendor. We know how important a secure, functioning gate is for our residents, and we are working diligently with the vendor to have the system fully operational as quickly as possible.

Thank you again for bringing this to our attention. Your feedback is important, and we’re here to help however we can.

reviews.author: Samari Keaton
reviews.text: I wanted to wait until I was here for a couple of months before I left a review. I moved in 09/2025 and it has been great so far. The only complaint I have is the gate. When I toured, the gate was functioning as it should. But ever since I moved in, it's only been closed about 2 times. I wish that would get fixed quickly because the gate was an amenity I really wanted.
reviews.response_text:
Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience, and we’re truly glad to hear that your stay has been great so far. We also sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you’ve experienced with the gate.

We want to assure you that we are currently in the process of upgrading the entire access gate system. Unfortunately, the project has taken longer than expected due to recent changes with the vendor’s software, but our team and the vendor are actively working to finalize the installation and ensure everything functions as it should.

We completely understand how important this amenity is, and we appreciate your patience while we get the new system fully up and running. If you have any additional concerns or need anything in the meantime, we’re always here to help!

reviews.author: Stephanie Nessenthaler
reviews.response_text: Thank you for the review Stephanie !! We truly appreciate you being part of the Eden Keller Family!!

reviews.author: Alicia Dunn
reviews.text: We stayed here for two years! Have no complaints! Always responded promptly to service requests and very responsive to emails and inquiries. Would highly recommend this community!
reviews.response_text: Thank you so much Alicia for taking the time to share your experience with us! We’re thrilled to hear that your two years here were smooth and enjoyable. Knowing that our team was able to respond promptly and support you throughout your stay truly means a lot to us. We appreciate your recommendation and were grateful you chose to make our community your home! Wishing you all the best on your next chapter! 🌟

reviews.author: RALI
reviews.text: Eden Keller ranch has stepped their game up with the events. I like the updates they send out and the friendly new management. The repair guys are also quick and on top of things. Shoutout Julieta, Kelly, Ben. They’re funny

reviews.text:
We were desperately looking for a new apt, we tour with Julieta (she was so nice, efficient and patient) and everything was perfect, apartments clean, spacious and modern, makes you feel like living in a luxury complex. reviews.response_text: Thank you so much for your kind words and wonderful feedback! We’re thrilled to hear that your experience with Julieta and your move-in process was smooth and enjoyable. Very comfortable apartment modern clean  . The outside is super clean and well kept .  the leasing office staff are always super kind friendly

Thank you so much for your wonderful feedback! We’re absolutely delighted to hear that you’re enjoying your home at Eden Keller Ranch and that our team has helped make your experience so positive. Knowing you feel comfortable and happy here truly means the world to us.

reviews.author: Cossondra Wilson
reviews.text: Have been living here for 4 years now and never had issues with management but recently have ran into the new female manager as she lives on site and multiple times now and some when her dog is off leash behind my apartment. She does not seem friendly she snoops around your patio and stares. We have had multiple pass by’s with no hello nothing. Her off leash dog has tried to jump into my first floor balcony at my dog and she didn’t have anything to say and allowed her dog to do that as she saw me trying to get my dog inside. First impressions are very important.
reviews.response_text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your concerns with us — we truly appreciate your feedback.

We want to assure you that the pet in question is often taken to this area to relieve himself away from others, as he has difficulty doing so while on a leash. This location was selected to be distant from other pets and residents, and we always ensure no one else is nearby. All patios in this section of the community are situated on a raised retaining wall, which prevents any pets from being able to access or jump onto another patio.

As part of our regular community walks, we continuously monitor the cleanliness and upkeep of all patios and yards to ensure our shared spaces reflect the high standards we strive for.

If you’d like to discuss this matter further, please feel free to stop by the office and introduce yourself — we’d be happy to speak with you in person. We also missed you at our recent community event where we welcomed residents to meet the team and get to know us better. We hope you can join us next time!

reviews.response_text: Joshua Tallman, we strive for 100% satisfaction, and we regret to find out that this was not the case. We hope to see you soon! - Justin Riddle

reviews.response_text: Thank you so much for the 5-star review! We truly appreciate you taking the time to share your positive experience. If there’s ever anything you need, please don’t hesitate to reach out – we’re always here to help!

reviews.author: Honest Review
reviews.text: Super satisfied with this complex, definitely one of the best kept up apartments I’ve lived in. Misti and Gabi have been very helpful these past few months as well.
reviews.response_text: Thank you so much for the kind words! We’re thrilled to hear that you’re enjoying your time here and that the community stands out as one of the best you've experienced. reviews.author: Alessandra Aguilar
reviews.text: this place has roaches man. absolutely disappointed. why do we pay a pest control fee if there’s bugs and several snakes everywhere. our toilet has been broken for two months without anyone in the front answering any phones, emails, or even being in the office. ive tried multiple times. i can tolerate a broken toilet and pests but what absolutely floors me about this place is how rude and unwilling to help the office is. the ONLY employee ive seen there doing their job is the guy who collects garbage (youre killing it man, thank you for that.) we moved in 7 months ago and im extremely disappointed with how it’s going thus far. parking is terrible too. and good luck trying to get a covered spot or a garage if you decide after moving in because again, they never answer anything nor are they present to be helpful. in fact im writing this review in hopes that this will change something or get someone to reach out but unfortunately i’ve written a review before and was told to contact them, tried to, no response so im not optimistic.
reviews.response_text: Thank you for your valuable feedback, Alessandra. I appreciate our conversation earlier and hope it provided clarity for both of us. Please feel free to reach out, I am always here to help!

reviews.author: Andy Tiet
reviews.text: I’ve lived here for about a year and have really really enjoyed it! When we moved Into our apartment it was in really good shape! The complex is really chill and safe and we’ve enjoyed all the amenities. Grocery store and other shops are pretty close too. We also recently got an electric vehicle and the property has some options for paid electric charging which is super convenient. All the staff in the leasing office are great and very helpful! Thank you!!
reviews.response_text: Thank you so much for your kind words and the 5 stars!! We’re thrilled to hear that you’ve had such a great experience over the past year. Thanks again for being a valued part of our community!

There is a big blue pickup truck wake up every body in building 5 in the morning at 3 am or 4 am . Everyday . It is a real bad. Why these people be allowed leave in a nice  apartment. Resistance quality is get low and low .

I think they let that guy know and look like this car Stop doing that now . Let see what will happen in the future. It is a midfield RAM 2500.
reviews.response_text: Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We recognize that early morning noise can be disruptive, and we sincerely appreciate your concern for a peaceful living environment. Please contact the leasing office so we may discuss this issue further.

reviews.response_text: Thank you so much for your kind words and the 5 stars! We're thrilled to hear that you had such a positive experience. Our team works hard to create a welcoming and enjoyable environment, and it's always rewarding to know our efforts are appreciated!

reviews.author: Dominique Padilla
reviews.text: Pretty nice apartments if I say so myself.
reviews.response_text: Thank you so much for the 5 stars and kind words! We truly value your feedback and If there's ever anything we can do to make your experience even better, just let us know!

reviews.author: Aura Karolina Espinosa
reviews.response_text: Thank you for the 5-star rating! We appreciate your support and are glad you had a great experience. Let us know if there's anything we can do for you!

reviews.author: Daniela MkkkIbanez
reviews.response_text: Thank you for your review! We're glad to hear you had a positive experience. If there's anything we can do to make it a 5-star experience, please let us know, we always appreciate feedback to help us improve!

reviews.author: Stephanie Van Sant
reviews.text:
RUN FAST. RUN FAR! I have never been treated so shabbily unprofessionally by a leasing complex or company. Documentation was disregarded. Strong-armed into paying additional fines under threat of credit reporting.

I would leave 0 stars if I could. When I was living at Elan Keller Ranch I had some problems. When I moved in in July of '22 as scheduled, the apartment was not properly cleaned. There were cobwebs, the carpet had stains. I documented this in the move-in inspection form. The door handled to the patio door was not properly affixed, the liner on the door was coming off. There was standing water in the apartment from hosing the stairway.  I left this in review and put work orders in. I had to put multiple work orders in to get these issues addressed - and the cobwebs, and the carpet was never addressed. I even left a documented review. Nothing. I decided to move on.

The next year a very loud family moved in above me rough housing, and loud noises, running children in the middle of the night. I made multiple complaints but this continued. I was told to contact the after hours police liaison, who told me to call 911 if I suspected someone was in danger. No one was to my knowledge (just loud roughhousing, children playing running, jumping at all hours of the night) and so my hands were tied. I continued to make complaints with no resolution.

I moved out in July of '24. I payed about 30% of a month's leasing charges to cover the week that I would be staying. I asked for a summary of charges in advance for the 7 days but they would not furnish me the charges. Not willing to pay a whole month's worth of the lease but not wanting the bank transfer to be marked as late, I estimated the charges at about 30% of the total monthly lease charges (this is the first 7 days out of the month that I was living there before moving out, mind you). I had everything moved out and professionally move-out cleaned by Spruce, the recommended and even sponsored cleaning company of Elan Keller Ranch. Everything was pristine, even the cobwebs were gone. Carpet was the same from move in, but cleaner. No mention of move-out inspection.

When I asked for my deposit back a month later I was told there were charges. The condition sink was devalued and the carpet needed to be replaced because of my use. I showed them the review after moving in - nothing. When I tried to get into touch to ask more questions, and for photos of of the sink, no reply. I called and e-mailed multiple times, nothing. Then I heard from the collection agency. I pointed towards my comments on the move-in inspection - they ignored that. There was nothing I could do because I hadn't set a move-out inspection appointment. I cited "normal wear and tear" clause as it appeared in my lease, as I knew it had had one. They told me they couldn't speak to that but then cited me the part of my lease that told me I needed to make a move-out inspection appoint if I didn't want to be charged after move out. Because the lease was in their online portal and I was no longer a tenant, they would not provide me a copy of my lease to reference this personally. They said I had the option to dispute, but then said in all honesty it would likely not be successful because of the lack of inspection. I had the documentation and they ignored it. I felt strong-armed into paying because I don't have the fees required for an attorney. They also said that this lack of payment had not be reported to the credit agencies YET, implying that if I did not pay they would. When I asked about if the dispute process would somehow be reflected in my credit score, they told me they couldn't answer that as that would be considered legal advice. Awful experience.
reviews.response_text:
Hi Stephanie,

Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback with us. We’re truly sorry to hear about your experience and the challenges you faced during your time at our community. At Elan Keller Ranch, we strive to maintain a high standard of service and ensure each resident feels valued and respected. It’s disappointing to learn that we missed the mark during your stay.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused by unresolved maintenance issues and the difficulties you experienced with noise disturbances. We understand how important a clean and comfortable environment is, and we regret that your initial move-in and the process for resolving maintenance requests did not meet expectations.

Regarding your concerns with the move-out process and final charges, we are here to help and clarify any misunderstandings. We want to ensure transparency in all our policies, including move-out inspections and final billing. If there’s anything we can review further or provide additional documentation on, please don’t hesitate to reach out to our office directly at 855-561-0029.

Thank you again for bringing these matters to our attention. Your feedback is invaluable as we continue to improve our processes and deliver a better experience for all current and future residents.

reviews.author: Heesoo Kim
reviews.response_text: Heesoo Kim - I'm so sorry to hear your experience didn't meet your expectations (or our standards). Our community manager would really like to speak with you about this. Please contact us at elankellerranchmgr@greystar.com as soon as you've got a moment. We look forward to hearing from you.

reviews.author: Heesoo Kim
reviews.text:
우리는 계약기간을 다 채웠고 이사 두 달 전에 해약 통보를 했음에도 이사 당월 렌트비 한 달치를 다 빼내갔고, 다른 지역으로 이사 한 달 후에 오히려 각종 비용을 첨가하여 더 내라는 메일을 받았습니다.
이사 오기 전 모든 것들의 원상 복귀와 청소 상태는 추가 비용이 들지않을 만큼 깨끗이 하고 왔음에도 너무 비양심적인 아파트 측에 항의하는 마음을 전합니다.  이사 나올 때 유의하세요!
reviews.response_text:
Dear Heesoo,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing your experience. I understand how frustrating it can be to encounter charges after moving, especially when you believe you followed the proper procedures.

We take feedback like yours very seriously, and I want to ensure that your concerns are addressed. I’d like to gather more details about your situation so we can look into the charges and review your account.

Please feel free to contact us with any additional information you can provide, including any relevant documentation regarding your move-out process. We aim to resolve this matter fairly and promptly.

Thank you for your patience, and I look forward to hearing from you soon. I can be reached at 817-546-7000 or via email at ElanKellerRanchMGR@Greystar.com.

reviews.author: Svetlana Alexis P
reviews.text:
🚫🚩🚫🚩🚫
Please be warned with this apartment complex!! I applied here a little over a year ago, and ended up not living here. Fast forward to 7 months later, I received a letter via email and mailbox stating that I owe a random number of $85 to this company and it has been sent to collections. COLLECTIONS!!! After spending money with the application fee (not cheap) and not being a resident of this complex, I still managed to have a collection from this place. I have tried to call the complex with zero attempt of call back or an answered call. PLEASE AVOID THIS PLACE. Take my NON-RESIDENT experience and run! I paid the random fee so my credit wouldn’t be affected, but what a corrupt business. 🚫
reviews.response_text:
Hi Alexis,

Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We sincerely apologize for the frustration and confusion this situation has caused you. We take feedback like yours seriously and regret that your experience with us has not been positive, especially as a non-resident.

Please allow us the opportunity to investigate what led to the charge and collection notice. It’s never our intention to cause distress, and we want to ensure any misunderstandings are resolved quickly. We understand how important this is, and we are committed to addressing the issue.

We want to personally follow up and make sure this is taken care of to your satisfaction.

Thank you for your patience, and we hope to resolve this matter promptly.

Thank you,

-The Elan Keller Ranch Team

reviews.author: Noell Hamilton
reviews.text:
I have lived at Elan Keller for 2 years, and decided not to renew my lease. When I first moved in everyone was so friendly, and welcoming. Some neighbors I’ve met I’m still friends with til this day. A lot of good perks for the area.

In my first year here, it seemed they could never keep a leasing agent. Each time I went into the office it was always someone new. They would never answer the phone, and were rude when they did. The property and the amenities were rarely maintained. Buildings on the inside were dirty from bugs, birds, weather, and people’s trash spillage on the concert. No one would pick up after their dogs, pool furniture continuously broken. The courtesy officer never coming to assist with complaints. If he did respond it would be hours later, or tell you to call the police. It was all very frustrating to live here.

Towards the middle to end of my second year of living here. I believe they brought in Andrea Gallegos. Things then started to change. The property was getting regularly maintained. The grass being cut, building cleanings, pool being cleaned more, consistent valet trash pick ups, etc. Once she arrived I truly stopped complaining to myself and friends that this place was a mess. She might not have been the only person to turn this place around, but for me it seemed like she the main factor. When I would go to the office I would get 2 different answers on a question. Which was frustrating as well. I went to ask her my same questions, and she was very polite along with informative. Ms. Gallegos definitely knows her stuff and cares about her residents. Now my only continuous issue is parking, but a few steps never hurt anyone.

Overall, the property and its management team I feel have come along way. I would recommend to live here.

Pros: close grocery store options, restaurants/bars, walking trails, coffee shops, etc.

Cons: Thin walls, loud neighbors, pet droppings on property, no parking, and right gate continuously broken.
reviews.response_text: Noell Hamilton - thanks for your lovely comments about our team. We'll be sure to let them know they went Beyond Expectations! Thanks again for taking some time to about your visit to Elan Keller Ranch. Be well!

reviews.text:
I loved our apartment everything was new and pretty nice. Maintenance was always responsive and efficient.
Unfortunately my Boyfriends car got stolen from the apartment complex. The apartment did not send out an email to residents letting them know this happened. I fear it wasn’t the first. We also had problems with bugs. There is a lot of standing water everywhere so bugs are pretty prevalent outside. Towards the end we struggled with roaches in our apartment. It was really disturbing waking up to them even when we plugged drain holes.
reviews.response_text: Megan Kesler - I sincerely wish we could have had this conversation prior to your leaving. I would have really appreciated the chance to fix these issues in the moment. It's truly upsetting to hear that you didn't receive the top-notch service we strive to provide. I'm going to talk to the team here at Elan Keller Ranch to see how we can improve for next time.

reviews.text: Kalaco is a great place to call home.  The property is inviting, warm and it feels like family here.  The regularly planned resident events are fun, and it's nice to see the staff out and about around the property.  A detail that I am most satisfied with is the overall appearance of the building.  It's nice to come home or invite others over and arrive to a clean and orderly property.  It's what sets this building apart from others in the area.  The staff has been wonderful - from Jeffrey to Sharon to Paul to Merideth to Tim and to Angel - and even our wonderful housekeeping team.  Thank you all for your attention to detail and for making sure our resident experience here is top notch!

We’re truly grateful for your thoughtful words! Creating a welcoming, clean, and well-cared-for environment — and hosting events that bring neighbors together — is something our team genuinely loves doing.
Your recognition of our staff and housekeeping team means the world to us. We take great pride in the details and in making Kalaco feel like home, and it’s so rewarding to hear that it shows.

Paul and Desiree are consistently knowledgeable, attentive, and were extremely helpful when I moved in.  If you’re looking to live by the Auraria campus, the Denver Center for the Performing Arts, the convention center, or the Sante Fe artist community which includes all the great restaurants - be sure to check the Kalaco website for current availability.

reviews.author: Drew B
reviews.text:
Stay away!!! I recently moved here, and the experience has been a huge disappointment. The apartment they tour you through and the apartment you actually move into are nothing alike. What you get is worn down, outdated, and full of old appliances that break constantly — and maintenance never shows up to fix anything. Just excuses.

I was originally excited to hear a new management company had taken over, but now I’m more unhappy than ever. The worst part is the communication. If you’re lucky, they might answer the phone, but they recently sent an email telling residents not to come to the office unless it’s “urgent” and can’t be handled over the phone. What kind of management company operates like this?

This place is going downhill fast. Beware and stay away.
reviews.response_text:
Hi Drew, 

We’re very sorry to hear about your experience and truly appreciate you bringing these concerns to our attention. This is not the level of service or care we aim to provide.

Our product and maintenance team is an area we take a lot of pride in and we assure you if issues are reported to us they are taken care of ASAP.

We would really like the opportunity to speak with you directly so we can review the condition of your apartment, address any outstanding maintenance items, and work toward a resolution as we have not had a Drew move in for a significant time so are unable to identify you to help assist further. Please reach out to us at your earliest convenience so we can assist you.

Thank you,
The Links at Plum Creek

reviews.author: B. R. (B.R.)
reviews.response_text: We are honored to receive your 5-star rating! Your support means everything to us at The Links at Plum Creek.

reviews.author: Ryan Degabriel
reviews.text: Stay away. I have had constant maintenance issues, in my unit that take months to be addressed. Most recently, I quite literally have a dishwasher that is falling apart, it must be 20 years old, it doesn’t wash dishes, it leaks and the face plate is falling off. After waiting 20 mins, they reapplied the face plate and called it a day. Be prepared to be disappointed here.
reviews.response_text: We apologize for the maintenance delays and dishwasher issues. It is our top goal to get each and everyone taken care of the proper way. We understand with time some things begin to wear and it is our top priority to make sure everything is functioning correct. If you are still experiencing some issues we are happy to make sure you are taken care of. Please call the office right away at 303-285-0220.

reviews.author: Andrew Winkler
reviews.text:
I am hoping this review reaches the owners of this apartment complex. My girlfriend and I have been trying to get in contact with someone from the leasing office for over two weeks. We have submitted online tickets to their "main" location. We have talked to the live chat agent on the website. We have called office well over 10 different times trying to get information. We have called Zillow and apartments.com to get information but they can also not get a hold of anyone. We have submitted an application for an apartment but have not gotten any response back. They are more than happy to try to charge you over $340 to submit an application but once you do you don't get any sorry of response. This is absolutely ridiculous. Please have one the managers or owners reach out immediately.

Despite my better judgement we decided to move in. Please listen to the attached video and see for yourself if you would want to live here. I am writing this review at 12:50am on our first night here. Already regret moving in.
reviews.response_text:
We’re very sorry for the lack of communication and the frustration it’s caused. With our recent takeover, we’ve been working through some technical issues that affected our response times but that’s no excuse, and we truly appreciate your patience.

Your concerns have been escalated to management, and someone will be reaching out shortly to assist you directly. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

—The Links at Plum Creek Team

reviews.author: Katherine Tatro
reviews.text:
I don’t usually leave reviews, but I felt compelled to share my experience at The Links at Plum Creek because of how welcoming and supportive the new management team has been. From the moment I first connected with them, Chad and Michael went out of their way to make me feel at home.
It's clear they genuinely care about the residents—not just in words, but through real action and follow-through. Any questions or concerns I’ve had were addressed promptly and professionally, and always with kindness. Their approach has completely changed the tone of the community for the better.
There’s something very comforting about knowing the people managing your home are approachable, trustworthy, and invested in making this a great place to live. Thanks to Chad, Michael, and the rest of the team, I truly feel like I’m part of a community—not just living in an apartment.
Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Hanna Ward
reviews.text:
Getting in touch with the on-site team has been impossible. When I first called, I was told the systems were down and couldn’t see available units or apply online. Tam assured me she would send me an application by email, but it never came. During the call, she frequently stopped to talk to someone else, and the background noise was very distracting.

Since then, I’ve left voicemails, submitted tickets through the main center (twice), and my partner sent requests through their website — still no response. It’s been over a week with zero communication.

This has been extremely frustrating, especially since I was excited about moving here. Unfortunately, with our move date approaching, we’ve had no choice but to look at other apartments.
reviews.response_text:
We’re so sorry for the delays and frustration you’ve experienced. With the recent transition, we’ve had a few technical hiccups, but we’re getting back on track and we’re excited to get things taken care of for you!

Your feedback has been shared with our team, and someone will be reaching out shortly. Thanks so much for your patience and we truly appreciate it!

—The Links at Plum Creek Team

reviews.author: Ricky
reviews.text:
There is a church right by the building and they loudly ring their bells at 7:13AM and again at 7:18AM every morning so there is no chance to sleep in on your weekend or off days.

Also, if the bank door is closed after hours, there is no chance for the delivery man to drop off packages without having a key fob. I personally witnessed a delivery driver unable to open the doors and I had to let him in through the main door (shared with the bank) and the door to our elevator... I do not even want to think about the packages that have been lost or stolen due to this.

reviews.author: Andy W
reviews.text:
I moved in to Slate June of 2021. Staff was very efficient and friendly with my move-in process. My unit was clean and looked identical to photos online and the unit I virtually toured.

The area (fletcher place) is extremely nice. There's a selection of 5-10 restaurants within 3 minutes walking distance, and you will frequently see people running on the sidewalks. Slate is built above an arcade bar and restaurant but very rarely will you experience noise disturbances. In fact, this complex is probably one of the quietest places I've lived. Majority of residents seem to be young professionals.

Maintenance is very fast, responsive, and always provides notice to enter your unit. There was one instance where one of my lightbulbs went out and maintenance replaced the bulb during a furnace check. I was surprised because maintenance staff took care of the issue without my prompting.

Regarding downsides, this unit is expensive, but I personally believe it's worth the price. It can be a bit tricky getting out of the underground parking garage because it's difficult to see cross traffic. The gym is also very small and has minimal equipment. It's a bit far away (10-15 min drive depending on traffic) from IUPUI and the hospitals if you are a student/resident. There is also no common area.

I left Slate in March of 2022 for work related reasons. I would definitely live here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place to family and friends.

reviews.author: Leah Miller
reviews.text: Beautiful building and great management!!!

reviews.author: hellojingya Y.
reviews.text: The rent is high but it is worth every penny of it. The negative review for Todd does NOT make any sense to me. He is responsive and professional for each interaction we had in the past 1.5 year.

reviews.author: Bethany Mascaro
reviews.text: My husband and I just left SLATE in June for a move to Washington state for work. We lived in two different apartments during our time at SLATE and loved them both - a 1 bdrm and and 2bdrm. They were both beautiful as well as functional. The staff is wonderful and the maintenance manager, Vince is amazing. Not to mention, you can't beat the neighborhood. You can walk to everything and the food in the area is excellent! I highly recommend Deylen Realty / SLATE.

reviews.author: Leslie Moore
reviews.text:
I just moved out of Slate this past June, but only because I was moving states -- what a wonderful place to live! Todd was always easy to contact and super helpful, maintenance was great, and I had an absolutely gorgeous view of Lucas Oil. I felt very safe the whole time, and it was overall a very QUIET place to live, which is a big deal for me since I am on call for work.
You really can't beat the neighborhood, either -- milktooth across the street, Bluebeard a few blocks up, and Fountain Square right across the bridge. The area is warm and fun, and it's really nice to be able to wake up on a day off and just grab a coffee at Calvin Fletcher and a croissant at Amelia's Bakery, then stroll around exploring!
If I were to ever move back to Indianapolis, I would move back into Slate in a heartbeat!

reviews.author: Matthew Ayers
reviews.text:
We just moved to Indianapolis from Texas this past Friday and our belongings were guaranteed to be delivered on that day, a guarantee for which we paid good money. When the delivery company failed to provide, Todd (the owner) and his staff from Slate stepped in to help make this transition smooth. They allowed us to stay free of charge in another fully furnished unit until our belongings arrived the following Monday.

This is an immediate example of the benefits of working with a locally owned and operated business rather than dealing with the personally, geographically, and altruistically amputated staff of a distant corporate entity, as we dealt with at our previous luxury apartment in Houston. Todd and his staff are easily accessible and are free to do the 'right' thing due to the lack of constraints from an impersonal property management entity.

Further, the area is great. Fountain Square has a wide variety of locally owned restaurants, is very walkable with low traffic, and is a very short distance from other nearby pockets of culture and fun. The apartment building has a relatively small number of tenants most of whom are young professionals, and is palpably quiet in the evenings which is conducive to a good night's rest. As new comers to the area, and the state, so far we are happy we chose Slate.

reviews.author: michael bornick
reviews.text: I do not know why people are putting up bad reviews for Slate. I am a current resident and it is awesome. Todd the landlord is extremely accommodating to every request I make. One of the few apartment complexes in Indy that allows big dogs.

reviews.author: Brandy St. Peter
reviews.text: Shelly and Todd are incredibly rude, disrespectful and clearly do not value customer service. Todd VanDeylen should be ashamed of the way they he speaks down to potential renters. Stay far away.

reviews.author: Todd Long
reviews.text: Todd Deylen is an absolute joke.  Rude, no customer service skills, speak to people as if they are 3rd world.

reviews.text: Just had a tour with Sam Harding. Was very polite and professional. Showed me the two bedroom and two bath, explained the whole process with me, Gave me some good intel to help make a decision. Due to her customer service out of the 4 I seen today so far they are number one. She may have sealed the deal. Thank you again. I would definitely reach out if you're looking for a good place to live. I may have found mine.
reviews.response_text: Thank you for the kind words, Angel. We're pleased to hear that Sam's tour left a positive impression. We hope our community becomes your new home!

reviews.text: Five stars for Wayne and the maintenance team! I called in a repair for my toilet today and it was fixed within 20 minutes of my call. I've lived here for 2 years and the staff and management are always top-notch. Safe neighborhood and great service!
reviews.response_text: Thank you for your kind words! We're delighted to hear that Wayne and the maintenance team were able to assist you promptly. It's wonderful to know you've had a positive experience with us over the years.

reviews.author: Matt
reviews.text:
Update: 11/27/2025
Making yet another update to my review on my continued great experiences as a tenant at the stonewood apartments homes here in Temecula.
I'm probably repeating myself at this point but I really can't get over on how much of a change that has been at these apartments since I moved in about 8 to 9 years ago. It was pretty rough in the beginning but this new team is just amazing. All the ladies on the office team are there to greet you with a warm smile and an open ear. They actually listen, how many folks can say in 2025 your apartment complex is looking out for you?
And that office team is backed by an equally as awesome and amazing maintenance team Wayne, Ernesto & every single one of the gentlemen that work on the maintenance team are great and awesome in their own right. I have been lucky enough to have every single one of the gentlemen working my apartment at one time or another for general routine maintenance.
As much as you all say thank you to us I wanted to say thank you to all of you for making my continued experience here awesome I look forward to MANY more happy years here with y'all.
Thank you to the entire stonewood apartment homes team and staff for your continued kinship and warm rapport  with my family and I.

________________________________________
August 9th 2023:
Well just want to make a quick update to my review. I'm going on now almost 7 years and I'm still loving the Stonewood apartments. Though the staff changes the folks who do come are always fabulous and the current team is even better than that. Big shout out to all the ladies in the leasing office.
Also want to make a quick shout out to the new maintenance staff member his name is Josh, this gentleman did an outstanding job in my apartment and I wanted to give him a public shout out for that. Anyone planning on moving to the stone woods I've been here now 7 years and counting and I don't have any complaints or plans on moving.

Thanks again to ALL the staff, y'all are all awesome.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Just want to take time and say that I really appreciate the staff here at the stonewood apts. Irma and all the staff are just great. Ready to listen when we have a concern or issue and always promptly responding to any issues and concerns.
I have been here for many years now and hope to continue to have many more.
Thank you and have a blessed day

Update!! So I'm going on a little over 5 years and still loving living here, the office staff are still so pleasant to talk to and the maintenance staff is equally just as nice and pleasant to have come and fix things in your apartment. Anyone interested in living in the Temecula area should come check it out most definitely!
reviews.response_text: Thank you so much for sharing your experience! We truly appreciate your kind words about our office and maintenance teams. It’s wonderful to hear that your time at Stonewood Apartment Homes has been enjoyable and that our team has made a positive impact on your living experience. We look forward to continuing to support you for many years to come!

reviews.author: Marissa Rubio
reviews.text: I keep getting harassed by the leasing office manager, I have always kept to myself, my apartment is spotless and I have never caused any trouble, he started with claiming I was past due on some bill (which I wasn’t, I always pay on time and I had actually overpaid at one point due to an error), but he kept harrassing me until I paid it. I was left alone and now (after over 2.5 years of living here), I get a note stating I’m not allowed to have a plant at my door???? Threatening he will be disposing of it if I don’t move it by tomorrow? Note was left today, this has NEVER been brought to my attention nor was it ever said that it wasn’t allowed when I moved in. I feel attacked and uncomfortable, my door and entryway is on the 2nd floor, there’s big distance between me and my front door neighbor (who has never had anything negative say about my decor). Stay away from this place, very unprofessional and not sure what type of issues these people have, prior management was much better, good reviews are probably fake. You tell me how the plant in the picture is obstructing anything or anyone! Horrible people!
reviews.response_text: We’re sorry to hear that you’re feeling this way. Our goal is to ensure all residents feel respected and informed. Regarding your account, the balance in question stems from ePremium liability coverage that was automatically applied when required renters' insurance was not provided with the appropriate documentation. We’ve made several attempts to communicate this, and we’re happy to review the details with you directly. As for the plant notice, our team recently conducted a routine inspection of all balconies and entryways in the community. A courtesy note was left to inform you that items placed in common areas, such as outside unit doors, need to be removed. At no point did we indicate that items would be discarded. We’d appreciate the opportunity to speak with you and clear up any misunderstandings. Please feel free to contact the office at +1 951-225-7880 or manager@stonewoodtemecula.com so we can assist further.

reviews.author: Josephine Yee
reviews.text:
Commendation for Outstanding Leadership and Team Excellence

Dear Irma and Taylor,
I am writing to express my sincere appreciation for the exceptional leadership and service provided by you and your team at Stonewood Apartment.  From my experiences, it is evident that your management fosters a welcoming, professional, and highly efficient environment.

Your leadership is reflected in the dedication and professionalism of your staff, who consistently go above and beyond to assist residents with prompt responses, clear communication, and a friendly attitude. Whether handling inquiries, addressing concerns, or facilitating lease processes, the team's commitment to excellent service makes a significant difference.

Please extend my gratitude to our beautiful office staff... Daniela and  Briana, and to our hard working maintenance team.... Wayne, Josh, Ernesto and Richard for their outstanding support. It is a pleasure to interact with such a well-managed team, and I truly appreciate the effort and care you put into making Stonewood Apartment, a great place to live.

Thank you for all that you do!

Best regards,
Josephine and Kristin
reviews.response_text: Hi Josephine and Kristin, thank you so much for your thoughtful review! Our team takes great pride in making sure our residents and guests feel welcomed and supported, and it’s wonderful to know their efforts have made such a positive impact. We will continue to be here to support our Stonewood community. Thank you again for sharing your experience with us!

reviews.author: Yesenia
reviews.text: This place is a joke don’t even bother they’ll do you dirty the minute you move out. Don’t recommend this location. The place I live before had a 5 star review that’s because the manager did a good job while living there. She even return all of our deposit. On the other hand, this location charge me the double all because they were remodeling the inside of the apartments to raise the rent for the new residents coming in. BEWARE  for those who live there for more than 10 years they’ll charge you double. Landlords don’t care about their residents remember that. You have the right to see your apartment before signing a paper for this location. Do research. My advice take photos before you moving in to show them how the place look before. Also make sure to record their conversation because they don’t keep their word. They said they weren’t going to charge me for something and then charge me for the same exact thing. When I told the girl about it she said “ I never said that.” Just be careful with this place. They’re nice to you now because you’re resident, but the minute you move out they’ll treat you differently. BEEARE!
reviews.response_text: We're sorry to receive your review. We take resident feedback seriously and strive to be transparent regarding lease renewals and move-out fees. reviews.author: Susan Baker Davis
reviews.text:
Not happy that we have no permanent maintenance person. The receptacle for the dog waste is over flowing and people are just throwing it on the ground. It looks and smells terrible, it's attracting flies like crazy, you can't even sit outside on your patio without attacked by flies. People are letting their dogs defecate on the grass and not picking it up. We are always told to take pictures of this happening, but we will be retaliated against because they will see us taking the pictures. The main entrance
Always looks nice, but the rest of the grounds always looks bad.
People don't obey the speed limit, and drive much faster than the posted speed limit.
I know nothing will be done about these problems will not be taken care of, but I just thought I would voice my opinion.

The office staff has gotten better, but I do have a complaint about the landscaping. Is there any reason that when they reseeded they used seeds for CRAB GRASS INSTEAD OF BERMUDA SEEDS. My first husband and I owned a landscaping business, that is why I know the difference in seeding.  You can certainly tell the difference in grass, and it truly looks like hell, some places have Bermuda but mostly Crab Grass was used.
Besides saving money, is there any other reason?

reviews.text: I really like my new home. Normally a quite place. Nice and homey.

reviews.author: Michael York
reviews.text: Very friendly, quite at night, very clean and maintained complex. Great location with everything in diving or walking distance. Staff is always there to help. reviews.author: Kristine Hesson
reviews.text:
I lived here for a year in 2020 and I liked it well enough. It is clean and fairly well kept. The maintenance was better prior to MEB buying it. The noise level is pretty bad. I was on the ground floor and the neighbor upstairs sounded like an elephant walking across his apartment. There are quite a few tenants who are irresponsible pet owners and don’t control their dogs; mine was attacked twice. They don’t pick up after their dogs either, there is always poop everywhere. MEB promptly raised rent prices when they bought the complex and the prices were already pretty high for how tiny the apartments were. My neighbor backed into my car and scraped paint off it in the parking lot; don’t expect management to do anything or care about it. I left due to buying a house and my mortgage payment is less than what I used to pay for rent…and now I have way more space. The former manager was nice but never really dealt with problems I brought to his attention. New manager was very nice but I moved out about a month after she started so I don’t know how effective she was. Overall these apartments are nice, but I hope they fixed the non functioning security cameras in the laundry room. Someone stole my earbuds in there and when I asked to see the security footage I was told by the manager that the cameras didn’t work!

Follow up:

I have now been moved out for almost four years and did not receive any money back. Not sure if I was supposed to, but I thought at least some of my deposit was refundable. Not surprised though, as this is the second time I have lived in an MEB owned apartment complex and there are always issues. They’re pretty crappy landlords and I’d avoid renting from them if you can.

reviews.author: Steven Blake - Christian Unitarian
reviews.text:
GREAT PLACE - I'm not getting any perks for writing this review, I just want people who are considering renting here to see it.
I have lived here for ten years. During that time there have been a few changes of ownership, and several managers - some good, some not so good.
As of now - December, 2023 - the ownership/management is top notch. I recently put in a maintenance request, and within two days (it wasn't an emergency) the guy came and totally fixed the problem. The manager is friendly and helpful, and it's quiet and peaceful around here (no homeless in the area). It is on the eastern edge of Tucson, with a lot of open spaces and a great Mountain View.
The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. The design of the apartments is wonderful (especially the upper level, with vaulted ceilings and a skylight). All have balconies.
If you're thinking about renting here, do it. You won't be sorry.

reviews.author: Janellie
reviews.text:
Living at The Hunter has been one of those rare experiences where every detail, from the moment you walk into the building to the way the light hits your apartment in the late afternoon, feels intentionally designed to elevate daily life. Even in early December, with the crisp Colorado air outside, our 7th-floor apartment radiates warmth, calm, and effortless elegance.

The extra-tall ceilings immediately transform the space. Light stretches upward and bounces off the quartz countertops, stainless steel appliances, the beautiful kitchen backsplash, and the wood-look flooring. Every corner feels open, airy, and thoughtfully designed. The stackable in-unit washer and dryer, garages, and additional storage options make everyday life smooth, convenient, and unexpectedly luxurious.

The layout options are vast, accommodating a variety of lifestyles, and the balcony is genuinely a private retreat. City views in one direction, mountains in the other — morning coffee, evening sunsets, or just pausing for a quiet moment feel elevated every single time. The apartment feels luxurious without being ostentatious, yet somehow still manages to feel like home.

The amenities go far beyond what one expects from an apartment community. Fitness and movement studios with embroidered towels that somehow make you feel fancy, coworking and conference/Zoom rooms that feel modern and professional, a heated pool and hot tub that are essentially resort-level, and yes, a golf simulator — every detail has been thoughtfully executed. Pet-friendliness is extreme, smart building technology is seamless, and the little touches really set The Hunter apart: custom-named Hunter mugs at the coffee station, embroidered towels in the fitness areas, welcome-home bags, branded pens, and the intercom system that lets guests in without a hitch — all adding layers of polish and thoughtfulness that make everyday living feel elevated.

The staff at The Hunter make the experience even better. Stephanie guided us flawlessly through our lease and moving process, and while Kyla wasn’t our direct agent, her helpfulness is felt throughout the building. Vanessa, the property director, manages the community with professionalism and warmth, and Chris in maintenance is consistently prompt, friendly, and effective. Together, they make the building feel genuinely cared for, not just managed.

The location is ideal: central to downtown Colorado Springs, restaurants, shops, and entertainment, yet tucked back enough to be peaceful and private. You get all the energy of downtown without the hustle and chaos. I had a hard time finding anything wrong — every detail has been thoughtfully executed, every convenience accounted for.

The Hunter even makes the little things feel like a treat. The payment portal is seamless and stress-free, the user-friendly apps make scheduling, rent, and community access effortless, and the intercom adds a level of convenience that makes welcoming guests feel effortless. Honestly, this is the kind of apartment that makes your friends jealous the moment they step in: from the light-filled interiors to the balcony views, the luxe finishes, the thoughtfully curated amenities, and the smart tech everywhere, it’s a living experience that elevates daily life without trying too hard.

If you want to live somewhere that makes you feel like you leveled up in life just by walking through the door… The Hunter is it.
reviews.response_text: We greatly appreciate your detailed and positive feedback on your experience at The Hunter. Thank you for highlighting the thoughtful design, amenities, and exceptional staff.  We strive to provide a warm and welcoming community for all to truly enjoy the elevated living experience, and are glad you're feeling this high level of service since day 1!
